weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Lesser).name: Alchemist's Fire (Lesser)
weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Lesser).description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 1d8 fire damage, 1 persistent fire damage, and 1 fire splash damage.

armor->Cultist Garb.name: Cultist Garb
armor->Cultist Garb.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->-4 to Will Saves vs. Higher Rank.name: -4 to Will Saves vs. Higher Ranking Cult Members

action->Fanatical Frenzy.name: Fanatical Frenzy
action->Fanatical Frenzy.description:
Requirements The cultist has taken damage and is neither @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} nor already in a frenzy

Effect The cultist flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the cultist gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls, and they take a -2 status penalty to AC. The cultist can't voluntarily stop their frenzy. After their frenzy, the cultist is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.3Wtzyb0ZgkaC7vHY]{Effect: Fanatical Frenzy}

action->Living Visage.name: Living Visage
action->Living Visage.description: While she has more than 30 HP, 287's appears to be a living creature. She has an automatic result of 34 on Deception checks and DCs to conceal her undead status and can Feed on the Living covertly.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description: When destroyed, 287's ghost re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} in her room at the Tsevel Center, fully healed. She can be only be permanently destroyed if her name is returned to her while conscious, or if the journal bearing her number is destroyed and its ashes are removed from the Tsevel Center.

action->Feed on the Living.name: Feed on the Living
action->Feed on the Living.description:
287's ghost touches a creature in reach. If the target is a living creature it takes damage from the ghost's ghostly hand with a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save. If the ghost is in their living visage they can disguise Feed on the Living as a benign touch and delay the effects for 1 minute while keeping the target unaware of the effect. A creature can be affected by only one delayed Feed on the Living at a time and if the ghost loses their living visage during that minute the Feed on the Living is lost.

Critical Success The target's life energy overpowers the ghost. 287's ghost takes @Damage[5[vitality]] damage, and the target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage, and the ghost regains HP equal to the damage dealt.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and the ghost regains HP equal to the damage dealt.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 minute and the ghost regains HP equal to the damage dealt.

action->Frightful Moan.name: Frightful Moan
action->Frightful Moan.description: The ghost laments its fate, forcing each living creature within 30 feet to attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save. On a failure, a creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to this ghost's frightful moan for 1 minute.

action->Ravenous Undoing.name: Ravenous Undoing
action->Ravenous Undoing.description: In each 24-hour period, 287's ghost must use Feed on the Living to consume 30 HP (any HP the ghost would gain count toward this total, even if the ghost has enough HP that they don't actually regain the full amount). If the ghost hasn't consumed enough HP, they mindlessly and recklessly feed on any living creature they come across until satiated.

action->Telekinetic Assault.name: Telekinetic Assault
action->Telekinetic Assault.description: The ghost cries out in pain and anguish as small objects and debris fly about in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. Creatures in this area take @Damage[6d6[bludgeoning]] damage, subject to a basic @Check[reflex|dc:30] save.

action->Living Visage.description: While she has more than 30 HP, 287's appears to be a living creature. She has an automatic result of 34 on Deception checks and DCs to conceal her undead status and can Feed on the Living covertly.

Success The target takes half damage, and the ghost regains HP equal to the damage dealt.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute and the ghost regains HP equal to the damage dealt.

If the ghost hasn't consumed enough HP, they mindlessly and recklessly feed on any living creature they come across until satiated.

action->Telekinetic Assault.description: The ghost cries out in pain and anguish as small objects and debris fly about in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. Creatures in this area take @Damage[3d6[bludgeoning]] damage, subject to a @Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save.

action->Motion Sense.name: Motion Sense
action->Motion Sense.description: A corrosive slime can sense nearby creatures through vibration and air or water movement.

action->Acrid Trail.name: Acrid Trail
action->Acrid Trail.description: When the Corrosive Slime moves, it leaves a trail of bubbling slime in its wake. After moving, all squares the Corrosive Slime moves from or through count as Difficult Terrain until the end of the corrosive slime's next turn. Creatures which end their turn in one of those squares must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save or take @Damage[2d10[acid]] damage.

Alystair Caskwater (1-2).name: Alystair Caskwater (1-2)
Alystair Caskwater (1-2).publicNotes:
Risen corpses of sailors who died at sea, draugr reek of the rot and decay of the briny deep. Their eyes glow with ghastly green light, and rotting seaweed, barnacles, and dead sea creatures cling to their bodies. Draugr can't speak, but expresses their malicious emotions with gurgles, as though they were eternally drowning with lungs full of water. They desire little more than to attack living creatures, especially those who sail the sea. Even when they go upon land, draugrs often drag the corpses of those they strike down back to the water, populating the depths with even more dead.

Draugr rise in the haunted places of the sea, where restless spirits, swells of void energy, or supernatural storms deliver death. A corpse might rest at the bottom of the sea for some time before awakening as a draugr. Collecting detritus and organisms, a corpse becomes increasingly disgusting before it finally rises. Proximity to intelligent life can expedite this process, and an underwater explorer who happens upon a shipwreck might cause a body to snap to unlife as a draugr suddenly. The creatures don't take intrusions lightly, especially upon their place of death.

Though steeped in evil, draugr are susceptible to reminders of their lives as mariners. In particular, a well-performed sea shanty or call-and-response work song might cause a draugr to become lost in reverie for a moment. The creatures have even been witnessed moaning along, unable to sing the words but providing haunting accompaniment. The lull rarely lasts long, though, as the beauty of the song quickly becomes a reminder of the tragedy that befell the draugr, reaffirming their desire for blood and death.

More powerful draugr with burning red eyes are called draugr captains. They're 3rd-level creatures with elite adjustments that can cast obscuring mist as an innate divine spell three times per day.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->The Void's Revenge.name: The Void's Revenge
action->The Void's Revenge.description: A creature that slays Alystair is subjected to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{Mariner's Curse} spell with a @Check[will|dc:17|traits:spell] save. The curse ends if the draugr is buried in a calm sea or after 1 week passes.

action->Grotesque Gift.name: Grotesque Gift
action->Grotesque Gift.description: Alystair's attacks spatter their targets with rancid flesh and rotting seaweed. A creature damaged by a draugr's Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:15] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Swipe.name: Swipe
action->Swipe.description: Alystair Caskwater makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within its melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A Swipe counts as two attacks for the draugr's multiple attack penalty.

action->Shoulder Check.name: Shoulder Check
action->Shoulder Check.description: The angry foolhardy mercenary strides up to their speed and makes an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} one adjacent target at the end of their stride.

action->Fire Crossbows!.name: Fire Crossbows!
action->Fire Crossbows!.description: The mercenary squad members draw or reload their crossbows, then launch a ranged attack in the form of a volley. This volley is a @Template[burst|distance:10] within 80 feet that deals @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save). When the mercenary squad is reduced to 8 or fewer squares, this area decreases to a @Template[burst|distance:5].

action->Get 'em!.name: Get 'em!
action->Get 'em!.description:
1 to 3

Frequency once per round

Effect The mercenary squad engages in a coordinated melee attack against each adjacent enemy, with a @Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d8)[bludgeoning]] damage

2 @Damage[(1d8+6)[bludgeoning]] damage

3 @Damage[(1d8+9)[bludgeoning]] damage

action->Troop Movement.name: Troop Movement
action->Troop Movement.description:
Whenever the city guards Stride, they first Form Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20- foot area (minus any missing squares), then move up to their Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the guards enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to all the guards.

The mercenary squad ignores difficult terrain (but not greater difficult terrain) caused by crowds or from movement through narrow spaces such as alleyways.

Arcadian Lurker In Light.name: Arcadian Lurker In Light
Arcadian Lurker In Light.publicNotes:
These malicious and strange fey appear as fairies about 2 feet tall, with insectile wings, large eyes, and bulbous heads. They slaughter and cause mischief in a pattern only their alien intellect understands, but they've been seen to take particular umbrage against dwarves, gnomes, and creatures who live in darkness. With their grudges and pursuit of their own wicked and sadistic whims, lurkers in light deftly overturn the conventional wisdom that creatures associated with light are benign and friendly.

While lurkers in light are fey and have ties to the First World, these creatures are often found elsewhere in the Great Beyond. They are particularly fond of invading the Shadow Plane to bring light to those who dwell there-not to help, but to spread misery and pain among those to whom light is agonizing.

spell->Dimension Door (Only when in brig.name: Dimension Door (Only when in bright light, and only to an area in bright light)

action->Blend with Light.name: Blend with Light
action->Blend with Light.description:
Trigger The lurker in light uses a move action

Requirements The lurker in light is in an area of bright light

Effect The lurker in light becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} until it enters an area of dim light or darkness, or until it uses a hostile action.

action->Lurker's Glow.name: Lurker's Glow
action->Lurker's Glow.description:
A creature that takes damage from a lurker in light's mote of light must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save.

Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to lurker's glow for 24 hours.

Failure The creature is lined in golden light for 1 minute and can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} during this time. If the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}, it is concealed rather than being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature sheds bright light in a 20-foot emanation for the duration of the effect. In addition, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} on its first turn after failing this save.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.6E8bOkwFzFuQ3ZAw]{Effect: Lurker's Glow (Critical Failure)}

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: A lurker in light's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Shadowed Illumination.name: Shadowed Illumination
action->Shadowed Illumination.description: Shadow pixies exude shadow, counteracting all other light and darkness effects their level or lower to leave dim light out to 10 feet (counteract rank 1, counteract bonus [[/r 1d20+7 #Counteract]]{+7}). The shadow pixie can suppress this effect with a single action, which has the concentrate trait. While the effect is suppressed, the shadow pixie's Strikes don't deal cold damage and they can't use their shadow spark Strike.

action->Shadowed Illumination.name: Shadowed Illumination
action->Shadowed Illumination.description: Umbral pixies exude shadow, counteracting all other light and darkness effects their level or lower to leave dim light out to 10 feet (counteract rank 3, counteract bonus [[/r 1d20+10 #Counteract]]{+10}). The shadow pixie can suppress this effect with a single action, which has the concentrate trait. While the effect is suppressed, the shadow pixie's Strikes don't deal cold damage and they can't use their shadow spark Strike.

Arrogant Entodemonologist.name: Arrogant Entodemonologist
Arrogant Entodemonologist.publicNotes:
Demonologists can pull a creature from the Abyss and bend it to their will... for a time.

Those initiated into the hidden truths and forbidden secrets of the world are forever transformed-or so they claim. To the cynical, a mystic is nothing more than a charlatan or zealot. Others profess to sense an aura around such luminaries and treat them with reverence, lest they offend some harbinger of unspeakable doom.

armor->Scholarly Robes.name: Scholarly Robes
armor->Scholarly Robes.description: Explorer's clothing is sturdy enough that it can be reinforced to protect you, even though it isn't a suit of armor. It comes in many forms, though the most common sorts look like clerical vestments, monk's garments, or wizard's robes, as members of all three classes are likely to avoid wearing armor.

equipment->Spell Component Pouch.name: Spell Component Pouch
equipment->Spell Component Pouch.description: This pouch contains material components for those spells that require them. Though the components are used up over time, you can refill spent components during your daily preparations.

equipment->Spellbook.name: Spellbook
equipment->Spellbook.description: A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

Ashen Brimorak.name: Ashen Brimorak
Ashen Brimorak.publicNotes:
These goat-headed demons have glowing red eyes and flaming hooves but measure only about 3 feet in height. Born from the souls of arsonists, the fiery brimoraks continue the work they pursued in life, as everything they touch quickly burns.

As a general rule, brimoraks are ill-tempered even for demons, although their spite turns to glee in the face of a growing fire. Those who have survived encounters with these fiends report that they remember the braying sound of the brimoraks' laughter as clearly as the heat of the flames or the choking scent of smoke.

Mortal souls that have been twisted and corrupted by sin sometimes arise in the afterlife as demons. These powerful and destructive fiends seek to spread their particular sin to warp more souls, thereby bolstering their numbers and continuing the cycle.

action->Extinguishing Aversion.name: Extinguishing Aversion
action->Extinguishing Aversion.description: Dousing a brimorak with water, either ordinary water or from a water effect, causes no physical harm to the fiend but deals @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage. Fully immersing the brimorak in water deals @Damage[5d6[mental]] damage per round.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair a brimorak's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

action->Boiling Blood.name: Boiling Blood
action->Boiling Blood.description: Each time an adjacent creature deals slashing or piercing damage to the brimorak, the attacker is sprayed with the brimorak's boiling blood, which deals @Damage[2d4[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save).

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The brimorak spits their boiling blood in a @Template[line|distance:20] that deals @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic] save). The brimorak can't use their Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

The ground within this area becomes slippery, with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease} spell targeting an area until it's cleaned up or the brimorak is able to use their Breath Weapon again, whichever comes first.

action->Flaming Weapon.name: Flaming Weapon
action->Flaming Weapon.description:
A brimorak's hooves and any weapon they wield burst into flame, dealing an extra 1d6 fire damage with each hit.

If they don't have a weapon, they can create a flaming sword of fire and steel (see flaming sword Strike in Melee entry above).

action->Fume.name: Fume
action->Fume.description:
The brimorak emits a cloud of thick black smoke in a @Template[burst|distance:10] that remains in place for [[/gmr 1d4 #Duration Fume]]{1d4 rounds}.

All creatures within the smoke become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the smoke become concealed to creatures within it. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the smoke it must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

weapon->Acid Flask (Moderate).name: Acid Flask (Moderate)
weapon->Acid Flask (Moderate).description:
Activate A Strike

This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, 2d6 persistent acid damage, and 2 acid splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Moderate).name: Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)
weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Moderate).description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 2d8 fire damage, 2 persistent fire damage, and 2 fire splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

weapon->Frost Vial (Moderate).name: Frost Vial (Moderate)
weapon->Frost Vial (Moderate).description:
Activate 1 Strike

The liquid reagents in this vial rapidly absorb heat when exposed to air. A frost vial deals the listed cold damage and cold splash damage. On a hit, the target takes a status penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn. Many types of frost vial also grant an item bonus to attack rolls.

You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls, the bomb deals 2d6 cold damage and 2 cold splash damage, and the target takes a -10-foot penalty.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.dv0IKm5syOdP759w]{Effect: Frost Vial (Moderate)}

action->Infused Items.name: Infused Items
action->Infused Items.description: An assassins' guild grenadier carries 2 infused @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Acid Flask (Moderate)}, 2 infused @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)}, and 2 infused @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.nVvH1ZcM7OwIVIs8]{Frost Vial (Moderate)}. These items last for 24 hours, or until the next time they make their daily preparations.

action->Far Lob.name: Far Lob
action->Far Lob.description: The grenadier's bombs have a range increment of 30 feet (instead of 20 feet).

action->Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
action->Quick Bomber.description: The grenadier draws an alchemical bomb with an Interact action and throws it as a ranged Strike.

consumable->Giant Centipede Venom (Appli.name: Giant Centipede Venom (Applied to One Dart)
consumable->Giant Centipede Venom (Appli.description:
Giant centipede venom causes severe muscle stiffness.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:17]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and off-guard (1 round)

action->Hidden Movement.name: Hidden Movement
action->Hidden Movement.description: If the assassins' guild rogue starts its turn undetected by a creature or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from it, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the rogue's attacks until the end of the rogue's turn.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The assassins' guild rogue deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Augmented Azlanti Elemental Nexus.name: Augmented Azlanti Elemental Nexus
Augmented Azlanti Elemental Nexus.descriptionHazard: A large cylindrical metallic structure surrounded by dense cables and pipes, anointed with mystical runes which glow and hum vibrantly. Elemental energy arcs off three spikes that may have once been connected to some of the cables.
Augmented Azlanti Elemental Nexus.disable: @Check[nature|dc:20] (trained) to restart the machine's connection to an elemental plane, or @Check[thievery|dc:23] (trained) to find and deactivate the whichever rune is currently active; three total successes are required to disable the nexus. A spike can be disabled with a @Check[athletics|dc:23] (trained) check to rip it from the structure or a @Check[crafting|dc:20] (trained) check to reconnect some of the cables. If all 6 elemental energies are returned to the nexus, it is disabled.

The hazard makes an elemental wave Strike against the triggering creature. The hazard then rolls initiative.

action->Unstable Detonation.name: Unstable Detonation
action->Unstable Detonation.description:
Trigger The nexus is broken or destroyed

Effect A ferocious gush of elemental energies bursts from the broken machine, dealing @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage to each creature within 15 feet (basic @Check[reflex|dc:20] save). The trap is then disabled.

action->Hydration.name: Hydration
action->Hydration.description: Azarketi must regularly submerge themselves in water to rehydrate their water-acclimated skin. After the first 24 hours outside of water, they gain a –1 status penalty to Fortitude saves as their skin cracks and their gills become painful. After 48 hours, they struggle to breathe air and begin to suffocate until returned to water.

action->Submerged Stealth.name: Submerged Stealth
action->Submerged Stealth.description: While submerged in water, an azarketi ruffian gains a +2 circumstance bonus on their Stealth check, indicated above.

action->Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
action->Quick Draw.description: An Azlanti cutpurse Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: An Azlanti cutpurse deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
action->Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, if an Azlanti cutpurse rolls Stealth for initiative, creatures who haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the Two-Timer rookie.

action->Blood Magic.name: Blood Magic
action->Blood Magic.description:
A surge of ancestral memories grants an Azlanti novice sorcerer or one target a +1 status bonus to skill checks for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.vguxP8ukwVTWWWaA]{Effect: Imperial Blood Magic}

action->Reach Spell.name: Reach Spell
action->Reach Spell.description: An Azlanti novice sorcerer can extend the range of their spells. If the next action they use is to Cast a Spell that has a range, increase that spell's range by 30 feet. If the spell normally has a range of touch, a Two-Timer sorcerer extend its range to 30 feet.

action->Blood Magic.name: Blood Magic

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.vguxP8ukwVTWWWaA]{Effect: Imperial Blood Magic}

action->Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
action->Quick Draw.description: An Azlanti thief Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: An Azlanti thief deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
action->Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, if an Azlanti thief rolls Stealth for initiative, creatures who haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the Azlanti thief.

action->Disorienting Dance.name: Disorienting Dance
action->Disorienting Dance.description:
The baby brine shark spins quickly in place, disorienting observers. All creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:15]{15 feet} must attempt at @Check[will|dc:17] save, with the following effects. The baby brine shark can't use disorienting dance again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Disorienting Dance]]{1d4 rounds}.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

weapon->Naval Pike.name: Naval Pike
weapon->Naval Pike.description: A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.

action->Leader's Command.name: Leader's Command
action->Leader's Command.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The leader orders an ally to attack or to get in position. Until the end of the ally's next turn, they gain the leader's choice of a +2 status bonus to attack rolls or a +10-foot status bonus to their Speeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Df5CnXnVHC1mVINK]{Effect: Leader's Command}

action->Pike and Strike.name: Pike and Strike
action->Pike and Strike.description: The leader Strikes with their naval pike. If this Strike hits, the leader can either move the target 5 feet within the pike's reach or make a sap Strike against the target without increasing their multiple attack penalty until after the sap Strike.

Barnacle Barnaby.name: Barnacle Barnaby
Barnacle Barnaby.publicNotes:
Feared by mariners and coastal dwellers everywhere, the aquatic ghouls known as lacedons are said to be the spawn of an ancient crew of sailors who became lost at sea and were forced to resort to cannibalism to survive. Their appearance is the stuff of a diver's nightmare, supplementing the vicious traits of their land-bound kin with spines, fins, and wide mouths bristling with needle-sharp teeth like piscine predators of the nethermost ocean depths.

Devious and cunning, ghouls can be found anywhere corpses are laid to rest, forever seeking to satisfy their boundless craving for humanoid flesh.

consumable->Rounds (Double-Barreled Pist.name: Rounds (Double-Barreled Pistol)
consumable->Rounds (Double-Barreled Pist.description: Firearms require ammunition consisting of a projectile and black powder. A round of ammo can vary in its composition but is typically either a prepackaged paper cartridge, including wadding, bullet, and black powder, or loose shot packed in manually. Some weapons, like hand cannons and blunderbusses, can fire other materials, but their ammunition has the same Price due to the cost of the black powder. Because making rounds of firearm ammunition requires creating black powder, you need the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.is3Oz9wt11lNq62K]{Alchemical Crafting} skill feat to make them. Firearm rounds are a valid option for magical ammunition, just like arrows or bolts. Crafting magical firearm ammunition requires you to be able to craft both alchemical and magical items.

consumable->Oil of Unlife (Lesser).name: Oil of Unlife (Lesser)
consumable->Oil of Unlife (Lesser).description:
Activate 1 Interact

This thin, black liquid imparts a bone-deep chill while rapidly repairing an undead creature's physical or spiritual form. When you dash oil of unlife onto an undead creature, or a living creature with void healing, the oil absorbs quickly into its body, and the creature regains @Damage[(2d8+5)[healing]] Hit Points. You can pour oil of unlife on an incorporeal undead; in this case, the creature absorbs the oil into itself.

action->Corpse Scent (Imprecise) 1 mile.name: Corpse Scent (Imprecise) 1 mile
action->Corpse Scent (Imprecise) 1 mile.description: The lacedon can smell humanoid corpses in the water from up to 1 mile away.

action->Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
action->Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The lacedon is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The lacedon devours a chunk of the corpse and regains @Damage[2d6[healing]] Hit Points. It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

action->Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
action->Ghoul Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

action->Paralyzing Spew.name: Paralyzing Spew
action->Paralyzing Spew.description: The lacedon discharges a spray of carrion vomit at a creature within 20 feet, dealing @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:19|basic]. A non-elf creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save to end the paralysis at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save. The lacedon can't use Paralyzing Spew again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Paralyzing Spew]]{1d4 rounds}.

equipment->Religious Symbol of Sezelrian.name: Religious Symbol of Sezelrian
equipment->Religious Symbol of Sezelrian.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol can be worn on the body on a chain or pin, or can be held.

action->Beast Training.name: Beast Training
action->Beast Training.description: Whenever a beastmaster cultist and one of their animal allies are adjacent to the same foe, they both count as flanking that foe regardless of their actual positions.

action->Enraging Whistle.name: Enraging Whistle
action->Enraging Whistle.description:
The beastmaster cultist blows on her divine whistle, riling up the nearby beasts, granting a +1 status bonus to attacks and damage to all allied animals within 60 feet for one round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.DPN3d9EZM9XqktWT]{Effect: Enraging Whistle}

action->Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
action->Swarming Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[1d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save). A creature that fails their saving throw becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round.

Blazing Skull.name: Blazing Skull
Blazing Skull.publicNotes:
More dangerous than simple severed heads, these skulls are wreathed in unearthly flames.

Beheaded are the reanimated heads of decapitation victims. These mindless undead fly through the air or roll around to attack their prey.

action->Fiery Explosion.name: Fiery Explosion
action->Fiery Explosion.description: When destroyed, a blazing skull explodes in a blast of fire and bone that deals @Damage[1d6[piercing],1d6[fire]]{1d6 piercing damage plus 1d6 fire damage} to each adjacent creature (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).

action->Flaming Shroud.name: Flaming Shroud
action->Flaming Shroud.description: A flaming skull is shrouded in hideous flames. It deals @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage to any unattended item it touches and on a forehead Strike. On a critical hit with a Strike, the target catches fire, taking @Damage[1d4[persistent,fire]].

Blessed Uirch of the Burning Suns.name: Blessed Uirch of the Burning Suns

shield->Sturdy Shield (Lesser).name: Sturdy Shield (Lesser)
shield->Sturdy Shield (Lesser).description:
With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.

The shield has Hardness 10, HP 80, and BT 40.

action->Protection of the Burning Sun.name: Protection of the Burning Sun
action->Protection of the Burning Sun.description: Whenever Uirch's shield is raised, he is granted a defensive aura of sacred fire. Any time he's hit while his shield is raised with a non-reach melee weapon or unarmed attack the attacking opponent takes @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic] save).

Blood Shadow Mirror.name: Blood Shadow Mirror
Blood Shadow Mirror.descriptionHazard: A dark shape moves in the surface of an ornate mirror, its eyes wide as blood seeps down its tormented face.
Blood Shadow Mirror.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:16] (trained) to fully cover the mirror or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 18) to dispel the mirror.
Blood Shadow Mirror.reset: 1 minute if no fresh blood has been spilled.
Blood Shadow Mirror.routine:
(2 actions; arcane, mental) The bloody figure in the mirror transforms to reflect a creature within 30 feet. The reflection bleeds profusely from the eyes, nose, and mouth, and the reflected creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18|traits:arcane,mental] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature bleeds from their mouth or nose.

Failure The creature bleeds from their eyes, mouth, and nose, and takes @Damage[1d10[persistent,bleed]] damage.

Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.
Blood Shadow Mirror.stealth: (trained); DC 0 to notice the mirror without noting it is a trap

action->Bloody Glare.name: Bloody Glare
action->Bloody Glare.description:
Trigger A creature spills blood in the room

Effect A ghastly figure of blood appears in the mirror's surface, forcing all creatures who can see it to attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save. The trap then rolls initiative.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature bleeds from their nose and mouth.

Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Bloodied Kithangian.name: Bloodied Kithangian
Bloodied Kithangian.publicNotes: The kithangian—a horrifying amalgam of horse and scorpion also known as a "beast demon"—is a foul fend born of the souls of mortals who abused and tormented animals in life. Kithangians tend to roam wild areas rife with animals to torture, though humanoid settlements with plenty of pets or livestock also make for tantalizing hunting grounds. Uncontested for too long, a kithangian's presence has a corrupting influence on the local fauna, which birth fiendish monstrosities until the demon is vanquished. If it realizes it's being tracked by vengeful druids or demon slayers, a kithangian assumes the shape of an unassuming animal so it can get the jump on its pursuers.
Bloodied Kithangian.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Animal Kindness Vulnerability.name: Animal Kindness Vulnerability
action->Animal Kindness Vulnerability.description: Kithangians find kindness to animals revolting. The first time each round that a kithangian sees someone heal or otherwise provide aid to a creature that has the animal trait, the kithangian takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
The kithangian can take on the appearance of any Medium or Large animal. This doesn't change its Speed or their attack and damage modif ers with its Strikes, but it might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Kithangian Venom.name: Kithangian Venom
action->Kithangian Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:23]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] (2 rounds)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (2 rounds)

Stage 3 @Damage[3d6[poison]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (2 rounds)

action->Rasping Tongues.name: Rasping Tongues
action->Rasping Tongues.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements The kithangian has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in one or both pincers

Effect Barbed tongues slither out of the faces in the kithangian's pincers. The tongues burrow into grabbed creatures and inject their minds with haunting psychic screams. Each grabbed creature takes @Damage[2d8[piercing],2d8[mental]]{2d8 piercing and 2d8 mental}. A creature can try to resist the mental damage by attempting a @Check[will|dc:23|basic].

Blowing Off Steam.name: Blowing Off Steam
Blowing Off Steam.descriptionHazard: Hidden vents emit scalding hot steam made from a particularly acrid solution, irritating the eyes and throat of anyone who inhales it.
Blowing Off Steam.disable: @Check[thievery|name:disable|dc:29] (trained) to block a vent, or @Check[crafting|name:disable|dc:27] (trained) to disable the heating element within the vent that turns the liquid into steam
Blowing Off Steam.reset: The steam vents cease to operate 1 minute after all creatures have left the area and go into a maintenance cycle for 1 hour. After this time, they can be triggered again.

For each disabled vent, the trap loses 1 action each turn.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}, and, struck by a coughing fit, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Close-Quarters Fighting.name: Close-Quarters Fighting
action->Close-Quarters Fighting.description: The blue-scarf heavy gains a +4 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures they have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

action->Sudden Rush.name: Sudden Rush
action->Sudden Rush.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The blue-scarf heavy strides up to 10 feet and attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a creature. If they succeed, they also deal fist damage to that creature.

action->Close-Quarters Fighting.name: Close-Quarters Fighting
action->Close-Quarters Fighting.description: The blue-scarf tough gains a +3 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures they have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

action->Sudden Rush.name: Sudden Rush
action->Sudden Rush.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The blue-scarf tough strides up to 10 feet and attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a creature. If they succeed, they also deal fist damage to that creature.

Busoborn Akata.name: Busoborn Akata
Busoborn Akata.publicNotes:
An akata is a hairless, blue-skinned quadruped with fearsome jaws, glowing eyes, a pair of thin tails, and a mane of writhing tentacles. It is a strangely silent beast, as it lacks the lungs and vocal chords necessary to vocalize. It also lacks ears, but it has heightened visual and olfactory senses.

When food is scarce, an akata secretes a resin from its pores that forms into a sturdy cocoon of pale green crystal-the skymetal noqual. An akata can hibernate in this cocoon without needing to eat or drink for centuries, though it retains a rudimentary sense of its surroundings and can break out in only a few minutes' time. These cocoons allow the creatures to travel through the void of space, seeking new worlds where they can infect suitable humanoid hosts with their larval young. Once a victim succumbs to this infection, the offspring fight among themselves until one proves the strongest. The surviving akata then animates the corpse-now a void zombie-which shambles about of its own accord.

action->Hibernation.name: Hibernation
action->Hibernation.description: After 3 or more days without eating, an akata can secrete resin that encases it in a noqual cocoon. The cocoon has Hardness 9, 40 HP, and a Broken Threshold of 18. It has resistance 5 to damage from magical sources. As long as the cocoon remains intact, the akata can't be harmed, and it doesn't need to eat or drink. While inside the cocoon, the akata gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.sebk9XseMCRkDqRg]{Lifesense} 30 feet. The akata remains in a state of hibernation until it is exposed to extreme heat or senses a living creature, at which point it can burst free of its cocoon in [[/gmr 1d4 #minutes]]{1d4 minutes}.

action->No Hearing.name: No Hearing
action->No Hearing.description: An akata has no auditory senses. It is immune to auditory effects, automatically critically fails Perception checks that require it to hear, and takes a -2 status penalty to Perception checks (but not initiative rolls) that involve sound but also rely on other senses.

action->Bark Shield.name: Bark Shield
action->Bark Shield.description:
Trigger The busoborn akata takes damage that isn't fire

Effect The akata hardens its body into a bark-like material at the point of impact and reduces the damage it takes by 5.

action->No Breath.name: No Breath
action->No Breath.description: An akata doesn't breathe and is immune to effects that require breathing (such as an inhaled poison).

action->Salt Water Vulnerability.name: Salt Water Vulnerability
action->Salt Water Vulnerability.description: Salt water acts as an extremely strong acid to an akata. A splash of salt water deals @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage to an akata, and damaging salt water effects deal 1d6 additional damage. Full immersion in salt water deals @Damage[4d6[acid]] damage per round.

action->Grasping Tendrils.name: Grasping Tendrils
action->Grasping Tendrils.description:
The busoborn akata presses one of its tentacle vines to the ground and causes it to spread beneath creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:15] in front of it. Until the end of its next turn, the area is difficult terrain to enemy creatures, and the akata gains a +2 circumstance bonus to attack rolls against targets within that area

Special The akata can only use this ability if it has no more than one creature grappled.

action->Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
action->Pack Attack.description: The busoborn akata's Strikes deal an additional 1d8 damage to creatures within reach of at least two of its allies.

action->Void Death.name: Void Death
action->Void Death.description:
An akata implants its parasitic larval young into any creature it bites, but only Medium or Small humanoids make suitable hosts; all other creatures are immune to this disease

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:17]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect 1 (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 drained 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead and corpse rises as a void zombie in [[/br 2d4 #hours]]{2d4 hours}

Busoborn Void Zombie.name: Busoborn Void Zombie
Busoborn Void Zombie.publicNotes:
A void zombie arises when a humanoid dies from an akata's void death affliction. This walking corpse is animated by a larval akata attached to the deceased creature's brain, using a grotesque feeding tendril that emerges from the corpse's mouth to drink blood from its victims.

A void zombie typically exists for only a few months before it collapses and the larval akata crawls free from the motionless shell. When it feels the natural end of its unlife approaching, a void zombie finds a secluded place to vomit forth the nearly mature akata larva, then withers away. The disgorged larva metamorphizes into a full-grown akata several hours later, usually eating the corpse as its first meal.

The name "void zombie" is something of a misnomer; though still compelled by necromantic energies, a void zombie is a host in the life cycle of a parasitic alien, not a mindless, reanimated corpse (despite their similar appearances). The fact that a typical void zombie shares the neutral alignment of the larval akata within, rather than the intrinsically evil nature of other zombies, has caused some scholars to push to reclassify them under other names. Suggestions have included "void dead," "akata spawn," or "bloodwalker," but the visceral and compelling commonplace name has proven difficult to shed.

The driving force behind a void zombie's violence rises from the ravenous hunger of the alien parasite that serves as the channel for its animating negative energies. Necromancers have tried often to duplicate the void zombie, but without a larval akata hosted within, the result is simply a zombie with missing jaws or, at best, one that moves faster than normal. Others have compared a captive void zombie to a captive yellow musk thrall in an attempt to discover a potential link between the two- after all, both are animated bodies controlled by a parasitic outside force. Strangely, a void zombie becomes particularly violent when encountering a yellow musk thrall, making direct comparisons of the two creatures particularly difficult, or even dangerous. The fact that a void zombie, unlike a yellow musk thrall, is actually undead may hold some clues as to the source of this strange behavior.

action->Salt Water Vulnerability.name: Salt Water Vulnerability
action->Salt Water Vulnerability.description: Salt water acts as an extremely strong acid to the larval akata inside a void zombie. A splash of salt water deals @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage to a void zombie, while full immersion in salt water deals @Damage[4d6[acid]] damage per round. The larval akata within retreats to the depths of its body on any round it takes damage as a result of this vulnerability, and the void zombie becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn.

action->Blood Drain.name: Blood Drain
action->Blood Drain.description:
Requirements The void zombie's previous action was a successful feeding tendril Strike against the target creature

Effect The void zombie uses its feeding tendril to drain blood from the creature it has struck. This deals @Damage[2d4[bleed]] damage, and a creature that takes this damage is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing (of any kind or amount).

Cacophonous Hound Echo.name: Cacophonous Hound Echo
Cacophonous Hound Echo.publicNotes:
Lean and athirst, the hounds of Tindalos are drawn to those who tamper with the flow of time, travel through time, or use magic or rare alchemical drugs to send their thoughts or perception back or forward in time. Powerful spellcasters can draw them from the Dimension of Time via rare rituals, but doing so attracts the hounds' ire, so few who traffic in such rituals live long enough to spread their knowledge. While the hounds possess great cunning and cruel intellect, they rarely interact with other creatures-other than to hunt and destroy those who have attracted their unblinking attention.

Once a hound catches scent of a mortal to hunt, it calls others of its ilk. The pack then pursues its victim through all space and time until it catches, slays and devours them. Those pursued can escape only by avoiding all angles, as hounds of Tindalos could step through them from nothingness at any time.

action->Churning Gaze.name: Churning Gaze
action->Churning Gaze.description: 30 feet. The hound echo's eyes glow balefully, causing the internal organs of a creature that meets its awful gaze to churn and spasm. When a creature ends its turn in the aura's emanation, it must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). A creature that critically succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

action->Otherworldly Mind.name: Otherworldly Mind
action->Otherworldly Mind.description: Whenever a creature targets the hound with a mental effect, that creature takes @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:21|basic] save). On a failure, it also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Vulnerable to Curved Space.name: Vulnerable to Curved Space
action->Vulnerable to Curved Space.description:
When a hound echo is not adjacent to a structural angle of 90° (or more acute), its resistance to physical damage is suppressed and it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. It can't recover from this sickened condition, but the condition ends automatically once the hound is again adjacent to a suitable angle.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.V60TWjo1G1r5ZtPM]{Effect: Vulnerable to Curved Space}

action->Limited Angled Entry.name: Limited Angled Entry
action->Limited Angled Entry.description:
The hound echo casts a 4th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate} spell, but it must transport itself into a space it can see that is adjacent to an angle of 90° (or more acute) in the structure or environment around it. For example, it could teleport to a space adjacent to a wall (using the angle between the wall and floor) or a corner in a room, or adjacent to a sizable tree growing straight up out of the ground, but not to a flat plain or a room with only curved corners and edges. It can't use Limited Angled Entry again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Limited Angled Entry]]{1d4 rounds}.

Once per day, the hound can use this ability to plane shift to or from the Dimension of Time, with the same restrictions on what angles it can appear next to.

Effect Until the end of her next turn, Shenga deals 1d6+2 bleed damage with her melee Strikes.

action->Reach Spell.name: Reach Spell
action->Reach Spell.description: If the next action the Shenga Heartrender uses is to Cast a Spell that has a range, increase that spell's range by 30 feet.

Carcaras.name: Carcaras
Carcaras.publicNotes:
Crocodiles can be found basking on riverbanks, lurking in swamps, or floating in lakes. They are usually are indistinguishable from logs when viewed from afar-at least until they attack. Alligators have similar statistics, but because they often live in more temperate climates, they endure cold temperatures better. Unlike alligators, crocodiles can tolerate salt water. Both are formidable predators that are likely to devour careless adventurers who fail to watch where they step.

Powerful and primeval in appearance, crocodiles are dangerous natural predators that dwell in marshes, riverbeds, swamps, and other wetlands.

action->Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
action->Deep Breath.description: The crocodile can hold its breath for about 2 hours.

action->Shockodile.name: Shockodile
action->Shockodile.description: 10 feet. Creatures that enter or end their turn inside the aura take @Damage[1d4[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save)

action->Death Roll.name: Death Roll
action->Death Roll.description:
Requirements The crocodile must have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Effect The crocodile tucks its legs and rolls rapidly, twisting its victim. It makes a jaws Strike with a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll against the grabbed creature. If it hits, it also knocks the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If it fails, it releases the creature.

Collapsing Debris.name: Collapsing Debris
Collapsing Debris.descriptionHazard: The room initially appears merely dilapidated, but on closer inspection it is positively liable to collapse at any moment.
Collapsing Debris.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:20] (untrained) to safely shore up the weaknesses in the masonry by replacing rotten wood with other assorted bric-a-brac, @Check[thievery|dc:17] (trained) to carefully place boards and the like to create bridges over structurally weak areas.
Collapsing Debris.stealth: (trained) to notice the instability in the surrounding woodwork and precariously balanced masonry.

action->Collapse.name: Collapse
action->Collapse.description:
Trigger A creature moves into the hazardous area

Effect Bricks and broken wood fall on the triggering creature, dealing @Damage[(2d6+5)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save).

Commodore Sticky Fingers.name: Commodore Sticky Fingers
Commodore Sticky Fingers.publicNotes:
The mischievous dragon sprites called draxies have dueled their pixie cousins for the title of ultimate prankster for centuries. They exercise patience and planning to create the perfect pranks, spending months, or even years, on their efforts. One exception to their flighty nature is the elucrea, a lifelong bond between a draxie and a creature they're particularly fond of, typically one with a good sense of humor. According to draxie legend, a little piece of a draxie's spirit remembers being united as the ancient fey dragonet Elucredassa, and that causes draxies to yearn for such connections with others.

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary, all sprites share a connection to magic and a diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The draxie breathes pixie dust in a @Template[cone|distance:15], with a random effect determined each time they use their Breath Weapon. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the effect. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:14] save or be affected.

The draxie can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

  1. The target takes the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} spell.
  2. The target loses its last 5 minutes of memory.
  3. The target takes the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep} spell.
  4. For 1 minute, the target is in a state of euphoria that makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Conference Z's Victims.name: Conference Z's Victims
Conference Z's Victims.descriptionHazard: The pain of over 300 souls crying out for recognition and revenge pierces through the room, as a spiritual whirlwind fills the space.
Conference Z's Victims.disable: @Check[medicine|dc:30] or @Check[society|dc:30] to determine 287's first or surname through the journal text or @Check[occultism|dc:32] or @Check[religion|dc:32] to connect with the spiritual energy bound to the journal to find her name. Two successes are needed, one for each part of 287's name.
Conference Z's Victims.reset: The haunt vanishes permanently if 287's name is revealed.
Conference Z's Victims.routine: (1 action) The haunt makes a howling wail Strike against all living creatures in area A13 as 1 action.

action->Please, See Me, Too.name: Please, See Me, Too
action->Please, See Me, Too.description:
Trigger The PCs start investigating the journal for 287's name

Effect The victims all beg for attention and recognition, lashing out at the PCs when they remain focused. The haunt makes a howling wail Strike against all living creatures and then rolls initiative.

Conference Z's Victims (9-10).name: Conference Z's Victims (9-10)
Conference Z's Victims (9-10).descriptionHazard: The pain of over 300 souls crying out for recognition and revenge pierces through the room, as a spiritual whirlwind fills the space.

Two successes are needed, one for each part of 287's name.

action->Please, See Me, Too.name: Please, See Me, Too

Trigger The PCs start investigating the journal for 287's name

Effect The victims all beg for attention and recognition, lashing out at the PCs when they remain focused. The haunt makes a howling wail Strike against all living creatures and then rolls initiative.

Consonite Clusters.name: Consonite Clusters
Consonite Clusters.descriptionHazard: Consonite forms needle-like stalactites that can easily break free if touched, setting off a chain reaction that threatens to pierce anyone who stands in the area.
Consonite Clusters.disable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:23] (trained) to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeeze} through the caps between the needles.

action->Needle Fall.name: Needle Fall
action->Needle Fall.description:
Trigger A creature touches any consonite cluster

Effect The needles snap, and the vibrations resonate with some of the surrounding clusters. The falling minerals deal @Damage[(2d10+9)[untyped]] damage to creatures within a @Template[burst|distance:5] surrounding the triggering individual (@Check[reflex|dc:22] save). The needle fall does not involve every consonite growth within these squares, so can be triggered again from the same location.

Consonite Needles.name: Consonite Needles
Consonite Needles.descriptionHazard: Consonite forms needle-like stalactites that can easily break free if touched, setting off a chain reaction that threatens to pierce anyone who stands in the area.
Consonite Needles.disable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:20] or @Check[thievery|dc:20] (trained) to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeeze} or reach carefully through the gaps between the needles.

action->Needle Fall.name: Needle Fall
action->Needle Fall.description:
Trigger A creature touches any consonite needle

Effect The needle snaps, and the vibrations resonate with some of the surrounding needles. The falling minerals deal @Damage[(2d8+7)[untyped]] damage to creatures within a @Template[burst|distance:5] surrounding the triggering individual (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save). The needle fall doesn't involve every consonite growth within these squares, so can be triggered again from the same location.

action->Motion Sense.name: Motion Sense
action->Motion Sense.description: A corrosive slime can sense nearby creatures through vibration and air or water movement.

action->Acrid Trail.name: Acrid Trail
action->Acrid Trail.description: When the Corrosive Slime moves, it leaves a trail of bubbling slime in its wake. After moving, all squares the Corrosive Slime moves from or through count as Difficult Terrain until the end of the corrosive slime's next turn. Creatures which end their turn in one of those squares must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save or take @Damage[2d8[acid]] damage.

Cosmic Amoeba.name: Cosmic Amoeba
Cosmic Amoeba.publicNotes: These blobs of nearly transparent protoplasm are identical in form and behavior to the microscopic creatures from which they have evolved, except their outlandish size makes them all the more dangerous. Unlike slimes, puddings, and other deadly oozes, giant amoebas have an outer membrane that contains their internal structures, making them more susceptible to slashing weapons than their amorphous kin. However, this membrane is also extremely flexible and permeable, allowing them to surround prey and absorb it, suffocating and slowly digesting it in the amoeba's acidic fluids.

action->Motion Sense.name: Motion Sense
action->Motion Sense.description: A cosmic amoeba can sense nearby creatures through vibration and air or water movement.

action->No Breath.name: No Breath
action->No Breath.description: The cosmic amoeba doesn't breathe and is immune to effects that require breathing (such as inhaled poison).

action->Envelop.name: Envelop
action->Envelop.description:
Requirements The cosmic amoeba begins its turn with a target its size or smaller @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The cosmic amoeba maintains the Grab and extends pseudopods to surround the creature and pull it inside the amoeba's body. This thereafter has the same effect as if the amoeba had @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.zU3Ovaet4xQ5Gmvy]{Engulfed} the creature (@Check[reflex|dc:17], @Damage[1d6[acid]], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} DC 17, Rupture 3).

action->Weak Acid.name: Weak Acid
action->Weak Acid.description: A cosmic amoeba's acid damages only organic material—not metal, stone, or other inorganic substances.

Crumbling Floor.name: Crumbling Floor
Crumbling Floor.descriptionHazard: At a cursory glance the tunnel appears to be little more than a waterlogged chamber.
Crumbling Floor.disable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:17] (trained) to safely navigate the wet floor without stepping on any loose masonry or @Check[thievery|dc:19] (expert) to cause a controlled collapse without any danger to the PCs.
Crumbling Floor.stealth: (trained) to notice the worn flagstones which are crumbling away at the slightest pressure.

action->Collapse.name: Collapse
action->Collapse.description:
Trigger A creature moves into the hazardous area

Effect The flooring crumbles, breaking apart under the creature and sending them into the stagnant water below, dealing @Damage[(2d12+12)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save). That creature can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} reaction to avoid falling.

weapon->Acid Flask (Moderate).name: Acid Flask (Moderate)
weapon->Acid Flask (Moderate).description:
Activate A Strike

This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, 2d6 persistent acid damage, and 2 acid splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Moderate).name: Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)
weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Moderate).description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 2d8 fire damage, 2 persistent fire damage, and 2 fire splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

action->Sacred Fire.name: Sacred Fire
action->Sacred Fire.description: Any non-consumable weapon the cultist wields gains the effects of the flaming rune in addition to a +1 weapon rune.

action->Sacred Sabotage.name: Sacred Sabotage
action->Sacred Sabotage.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The cultist of Sezelrian can draw a poison and quickly apply it to the weapon or unarmed attack of an adjacent ally.

Dangerous Collapsing Debris.name: Dangerous Collapsing Debris
Dangerous Collapsing Debris.descriptionHazard: The room initially appears merely dilapidated, but on closer inspection it is positively liable to collapse at any moment.
Dangerous Collapsing Debris.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:23] (untrained) to safely shore up the weaknesses in the masonry by replacing rotten wood with other assorted bric-a-brac, @Check[thievery|dc:20] (trained) to carefully place boards and the like to create bridges over structurally weak areas.
Dangerous Collapsing Debris.stealth: (trained) to notice the instability in the surrounding woodwork and precariously balanced masonry.

action->Collapse.name: Collapse
action->Collapse.description:
Trigger A creature moves into the hazardous area

Effect Bricks and broken wood fall on the triggering creature, dealing @Damage[(2d10+13)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save).

Delicate Crumbling Floor.name: Delicate Crumbling Floor
Delicate Crumbling Floor.descriptionHazard: At a cursory glance the tunnel appears to be little more than a waterlogged chamber.
Delicate Crumbling Floor.disable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:20] (trained) to safely navigate the wet floor without stepping on any loose masonry or @Check[thievery|dc:22] (expert) to cause a controlled collapse without any danger to the PCs.
Delicate Crumbling Floor.stealth: (trained) to notice the worn flagstones which are crumbling away at the slightest pressure.

action->Collapse.name: Collapse
action->Collapse.description:
Trigger A creature moves into the hazardous area

Effect The flooring crumbles, breaking apart under the creature and sending them into the stagnant water below, dealing @Damage[(4d12+10)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save). That creature can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} reaction to avoid falling.

Deskari Cultist.name: Deskari Cultist
Deskari Cultist.allSavesBonus: -2 will vs. higher-ranking members of the cult

armor->Cultist Garb.name: Cultist Garb
armor->Cultist Garb.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

Deskari Effigy.descriptionHazard: A statuette of the deceased demon lord creates frightening illusions of insect swarms.
Deskari Effigy.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:17] (expert) or @Check[religion|dc:17] (trained) to deactivate the effigy or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 20) to dispel the statuette
Deskari Effigy.reset: 1 minute as the illusory insects harass intruders before scuttling into the earth.

action->False Swarm.name: False Swarm
action->False Swarm.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 30 feet of the hidden entrance without saying the cultists' password

Effect A swarm of illusionary insects bursts out of the grass in a @Template[cone|distance:60] from the Deskari effigy and seemingly crawl over the intruders, shrieking incessantly. All creatures in the area must make a @Check[fortitude|dc:16] save or become temporarily @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute (deafened and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute on a critical failure).

Deskari Fantatic.name: Deskari Fantatic
Deskari Fantatic.allSavesBonus: -2 will vs. higher-ranking members of the cult

armor->Cultist Garb.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Lesser).description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 1d8 fire damage, 1 persistent fire damage, and 1 fire splash damage.
