armor->Cultist Garb.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->-2 to Will Saves vs. Higher Rank.name: -2 to Will Saves vs. Higher Ranking Cult Members

action->Fanatical Frenzy.name: Fanatical Frenzy
action->Fanatical Frenzy.description:
Requirements The cultist has taken damage and is neither @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} nor already in a frenzy

Effect The cultist flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the cultist gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls, and they take a -2 status penalty to AC. The cultist can't voluntarily stop their frenzy. After their frenzy, the cultist is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.3Wtzyb0ZgkaC7vHY]{Effect: Fanatical Frenzy}

Draugr Captain.name: Draugr Captain
Draugr Captain.publicNotes:
Risen corpses of sailors who died at sea, draugr reek of the rot and decay of the briny deep. Their eyes glow with ghastly green light, and rotting seaweed, barnacles, and dead sea creatures cling to their bodies. Draugr can't speak, but expresses their malicious emotions with gurgles, as though they were eternally drowning with lungs full of water. They desire little more than to attack living creatures, especially those who sail the sea. Even when they go upon land, draugrs often drag the corpses of those they strike down back to the water, populating the depths with even more dead.

Draugr rise in the haunted places of the sea, where restless spirits, swells of void energy, or supernatural storms deliver death. A corpse might rest at the bottom of the sea for some time before awakening as a draugr. Collecting detritus and organisms, a corpse becomes increasingly disgusting before it finally rises. Proximity to intelligent life can expedite this process, and an underwater explorer who happens upon a shipwreck might cause a body to snap to unlife as a draugr suddenly. The creatures don't take intrusions lightly, especially upon their place of death.

Though steeped in evil, draugr are susceptible to reminders of their lives as mariners. In particular, a well-performed sea shanty or call-and-response work song might cause a draugr to become lost in reverie for a moment. The creatures have even been witnessed moaning along, unable to sing the words but providing haunting accompaniment. The lull rarely lasts long, though, as the beauty of the song quickly becomes a reminder of the tragedy that befell the draugr, reaffirming their desire for blood and death.

More powerful draugr with burning red eyes are called draugr captains. They're 3rd-level creatures with elite adjustments that can cast obscuring mist as an innate divine spell three times per day.

weapon->Greataxe.name: Greataxe
weapon->Greataxe.description: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often "bearded," having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Grotesque Gift.name: Grotesque Gift
action->Grotesque Gift.description: A draugr's attacks spatter their targets with rancid flesh and rotting seaweed. A creature damaged by a draugr's Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:17] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Swipe.name: Swipe
action->Swipe.description: The draugr makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within its melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A Swipe counts as two attacks for the draugr's multiple attack penalty.

Dull Pukwudgie.name: Dull Pukwudgie
Dull Pukwudgie.publicNotes:
Pukwudgies go by many names in many regions, but those who know of them agree that defying their mischievous nature provokes their wrath.

In ancient times, pukwudgies traveled to the Material Plane from the First World, perhaps in the wake of the gnome emigration. These proud fey are obsessed with displays of respect, and while they first attempted to befriend mortals, each attempt ended in tragedy as the pukwudgies perceived any potential slight as a grave insult. Mortals, fearing these reactions, began to view pukwudgies as nuisances, and pukwudgies in turn began to resent mortals and the gods that favored them. At their best, pukwudgies play cruel jokes on mortals they encounter. At their worst, they've been known to kidnap and even kill those who don't treat them with proper respect.

Pukwudgies make their villages in the oldest forests, concealed under @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage} spells and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.nA0XlPsnMNrQMpio]{Fantastic Facade} rituals. They travel freely between the Material Plane and the First World through tiny portals beneath hills, trees, or stones. No strangers to violence, pukwudgies rarely travel alone and often anoint their quills or weapons with a custom-brewed poison before entering hostile situations.

Standing about 2 feet tall, a pukwudgie sports sharp quills growing from their head that extends down their back. Their skin tone varies by the region in which they live, ranging from pale gray to brown.

action->Defensive Quills.name: Defensive Quills
action->Defensive Quills.description:
A creature that hits a pukwudgie with an unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee Strike takes @Damage[3d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save). On a critical failure, the creature also takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,poison]] from the poisoned quills.

Note: A DC was not provided for this ability by Paizo. The DC present here is a moderate DC for the creature level according to the Gamemastery Guide creature building Tables

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
The pukwudgie takes on the physical form of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-3.Actor.IijUBFE1vhvgowhD]{Giant Porcupine}. Their size changes to Medium, they lose their weapon Strikes, and they gain a quill Strike (+16 for 2d8+4 piercing plus 1d8 persistent poison).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Pukwudgie Poison.name: Pukwudgie Poison
action->Pukwudgie Poison.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:23]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, and stupefied 2 (1 round)

action->Shadowed Illumination.name: Shadowed Illumination
action->Shadowed Illumination.description: Shadow pixies exude shadow, counteracting all other light and darkness effects their level or lower to leave dim light out to 10 feet (counteract rank 2, counteract bonus [[/r 1d20+9 #Counteract]]{+9}). The shadow pixie can suppress this effect with a single action, which has the concentrate trait. While the effect is suppressed, the shadow pixie's Strikes don't deal cold damage and they can't use their shadow spark Strike.

action->Shadowed Illumination.name: Shadowed Illumination
action->Shadowed Illumination.description: Umbral pixies exude shadow, counteracting all other light and darkness effects their level or lower to leave dim light out to 10 feet (counteract rank 4, counteract bonus [[/r 1d20+12 #Counteract]]{+12}). The shadow pixie can suppress this effect with a single action, which has the concentrate trait. While the effect is suppressed, the shadow pixie's Strikes don't deal cold damage and they can't use their shadow spark Strike.

Elite Commodore Sticky Fingers.name: Elite Commodore Sticky Fingers
Elite Commodore Sticky Fingers.publicNotes:
The mischievous dragon sprites called draxies have dueled their pixie cousins for the title of ultimate prankster for centuries. They exercise patience and planning to create the perfect pranks, spending months, or even years, on their efforts. One exception to their flighty nature is the elucrea, a lifelong bond between a draxie and a creature they're particularly fond of, typically one with a good sense of humor. According to draxie legend, a little piece of a draxie's spirit remembers being united as the ancient fey dragonet Elucredassa, and that causes draxies to yearn for such connections with others.

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary, all sprites share a connection to magic and a diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The draxie breathes pixie dust in a @Template[cone|distance:15], with a random effect determined each time they use their Breath Weapon. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the effect. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:16] save or be affected.

The draxie can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

  1. The target takes the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} spell.
  2. The target loses its last 5 minutes of memory.
  3. The target takes the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep} spell.
  4. For 1 minute, the target is in a state of euphoria that makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Elite Grig (PFS Q18).name: Elite Grig (PFS Q18)
Elite Grig (PFS Q18).publicNotes:
Grigs are kindly musicians of the fey, often getting themselves into trouble due to their penchant for confronting evil well beyond their ability to vanquish. Even so, they fight bravely and with great cunning, using their magic and ranged sonic attacks while flying and leaping using their wings and powerful cricket-like lower torsos to stay out of reach.

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary from the benevolent grig to the trickster pixie, all sprites share a connection to magic and diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.

action->Fiddle.name: Fiddle
action->Fiddle.description:
A grig can rub its legs together to create a catchy fiddling tune that compels others within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} to dance about, with varying effects depending on a @Check[will|dc:20] save. A listener is temporarily immune for 10 minutes on a success, but otherwise, if the grig continues to Fiddle each round, the creature receives no additional saves.

Success No effect

Failure @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} and -10-foot status penalty to Speeds

Critical Failure As failure, and also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wJsOZsYI2ZUVcGxc]{Effect: Fiddle}

Elite Hound Of Tindalos.name: Elite Hound Of Tindalos
Elite Hound Of Tindalos.publicNotes:
Lean and athirst, the hounds of Tindalos are drawn to those who tamper with the flow of time, travel through time, or use magic or rare alchemical drugs to send their thoughts or perception back or forward in time. Powerful spellcasters can draw them from the Dimension of Time via rare rituals, but doing so attracts the hounds' ire, so few who traffic in such rituals live long enough to spread their knowledge. While the hounds possess great cunning and cruel intellect, they rarely interact with other creatures-other than to hunt and destroy those who have attracted their unblinking attention.

Once a hound catches scent of a mortal to hunt, it calls others of its ilk. The pack then pursues its victim through all space and time until it catches, slays and devours them. Those pursued can escape only by avoiding all angles, as hounds of Tindalos could step through them from nothingness at any time.

Elite Lively Commodore Sticky Fingers.name: Elite Lively Commodore Sticky Fingers
Elite Lively Commodore Sticky Fingers.publicNotes:
The mischievous dragon sprites called draxies have dueled their pixie cousins for the title of ultimate prankster for centuries. They exercise patience and planning to create the perfect pranks, spending months, or even years, on their efforts. One exception to their flighty nature is the elucrea, a lifelong bond between a draxie and a creature they're particularly fond of, typically one with a good sense of humor. According to draxie legend, a little piece of a draxie's spirit remembers being united as the ancient fey dragonet Elucredassa, and that causes draxies to yearn for such connections with others.

While their dispositions vary, all sprites share a connection to magic and a diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.

  3. The target takes the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep} spell.
  4. For 1 minute, the target is in a state of euphoria that makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Elite Mutant Cryptid Snapdrake.name: Elite Mutant Cryptid Snapdrake
Elite Mutant Cryptid Snapdrake.publicNotes: Skilled kizidhar mages and gardeners handcraft these lovely creatures as much for their shuyookhs' aesthetic pleasure as for their protection. Creating a snapdrake requires first painstakingly constructing a frame of living wood in the shape of a drake before weaving thousands of colorful snapdragon flowers into intricate patterns to form its body and scales. Once complete, snapdrakes often serve kizidhars as a combination of guards, pets, and decorations for as long as they are well fed.

action->Alluring Scent.name: Alluring Scent
action->Alluring Scent.description: 30 feet. A creature that enters the emanation must attempt a @Check[will|dc:28] save. On a failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the snapdrake and must use at least 1 action on its next turn to Stride closer to the snapdrake. On a success, the target is immune to the snapdrake's alluring scent for 1 hour.

action->Explosive End.name: Explosive End
action->Explosive End.description: The mutant snapdrake's death reveals one last surprise as it explodes into splinters. When it dies, it explodes, dealing @Damage[5d6[piercing]] damage to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10], with a basic @Check[reflex|dc:30] save.

action->Greater Forest Passage.name: Greater Forest Passage
action->Greater Forest Passage.description: The snapdrake ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain from plants and fungi.

action->Marrowlance.name: Marrowlance
action->Marrowlance.description: The mutant cryptid can make wicked spears of bone erupt from its body. The creature can make marrowlance ranged unarmed attacks. Use the highest attack modifier from the creature's highest ranged Strike, as well as the damage from that Strike. If it has no ranged attacks, use moderate accuracy and low damage for the creature's level. Marrowlance unarmed attacks have a range of 60 feet and the versatile S trait.

action->Shifting Iridescence.name: Shifting Iridescence
action->Shifting Iridescence.description: Whenever the mutant snapdrake takes energy damage to which it isn't resistant or immune, after taking the damage normally, it gains resistance 10 to that damage type. If it had a resistance to a different damage type from shifting iridescence, it replaces the old resistance with the new resistance.

action->Snapdrake Pollen.name: Snapdrake Pollen
action->Snapdrake Pollen.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:30]

Maximum Duration 8 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage plus dazzled and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (2 rounds)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} and sickened 1 (2 rounds)

action->Speed Surge.name: Speed Surge
action->Speed Surge.description:
Frequency 3 times per day

Effect The snapdrake moves up to twice its Speed.

action->Spray Pollen.name: Spray Pollen
action->Spray Pollen.description: The snapdrake breathes a blast of pollen in a @Template[cone|distance:40]. Creatures caught in the blast must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save or be exposed to snapdrake pollen. The snapdrake can't use Spray Pollen again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Spray Pollen]]{1d6 rounds}.

action->Unusual Bane.name: Unusual Bane
action->Unusual Bane.description: This mutant snapdrake is traumatized by the former Conference Z staff who teamed up to hold it down while experimenting on it. The first time each round the mutant snapdrake comes within 15 feet of any character who took the Aid action, or is attacked while being flanked by two characters, it takes @Damage[10[mental]] damage and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save. On a failure, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure).

Elite Sewer Ooze (PFS Q18).name: Elite Sewer Ooze (PFS Q18)
Elite Sewer Ooze (PFS Q18).publicNotes:
These amorphous masses of sewage and other detritus make their way through filthy culverts beneath cities large and small.

Slimes, molds, and other oozes can be found in dank dungeons and shadowed forests. While not necessarily evil, some grow to enormous sizes and have insatiable appetites.

action->Motion Sense 60 feet.name: Motion Sense 60 feet
action->Motion Sense 60 feet.description: A sewer ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

action->Filth Wave.name: Filth Wave
action->Filth Wave.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The sewer ooze unleashes a wave of filth, covering all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:20]. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:19] save or take @Damage[(1d4+4)[acid]] damage and take a –10-foot penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute (on a critical failure, the creature also falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}).

A creature can spend an Interact action to clean someone off, decreasing the Speed penalty by 5 feet with each action.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Qomp2EujVCbzJb4X]{Effect: Filth Wave}

Elite Sprite (PFS Q18).name: Elite Sprite (PFS Q18)
Elite Sprite (PFS Q18).publicNotes:
Common sprites, sometimes called firefly sprites, are primeval guardians that latch onto a person, place, or object and defend it for their own inscrutable reasons. Their dispositions vary from kind to spiteful, but all sprites have a capricious streak. Being only about 9 inches tall, they are wary of animals that might hunt them, particularly house cats, and prefer flight to a fight. On the other hand, sprites are incredibly curious about all forms of magic and heedlessly gather around ley line nexuses or other places of power.

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary, all sprites share a connection to magic and a diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.

action->Luminous Fire.name: Luminous Fire
action->Luminous Fire.description: A sprite naturally sheds light like a torch. The sprite can extinguish, rekindle, or change the color of this light by using an action with the concentrate trait. While this light is extinguished, the sprite's Strikes don't deal fire damage, and they can't use their luminous spark Strike.

action->Vulkariki Athletics.name: Vulkariki Athletics
action->Vulkariki Athletics.description: A vulkariki eidolon can use Acrobatics instead of Athletics on checks normally requiring Athletics.

action->Vulkariki Tricks.name: Vulkariki Tricks
action->Vulkariki Tricks.description: A vulkariki eidolon can use Acrobatics instead of Thievery to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ijZ0DDFpMkWqaShd]{Palm an Object} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal}.

Empowered Daeodon.name: Empowered Daeodon
Empowered Daeodon.publicNotes:
Where the typical boar is merely ill-tempered and generally unfriendly, the towering daeodon is legitimately hateful and ruthlessly violent. Although omnivorous, the daeodon prefers to feed on flesh. Primarily a scavenger, the daeodon isn't adverse to attacking creatures it encounters while searching for easier meals, or to protect any perceived encroachment into its lair or feeding grounds. Particularly brave or skilled orcs are fond of using daeodons as mounts or war-trained battle beasts; orc cavalry mounted on daeodons is a fearsome force indeed.

A typical adult daeodon is 10 feet long and 7 feet tall at the shoulder. It weighs approximately 2,000 pounds.

While domesticated pigs are a staple of farm life, wild boars are much more dangerous. Foul-tempered warthogs are relatively common, while the lumbering, primeval beasts known as daeodons are less so. Voracious eaters, boars can ravage the countryside in which they live. Boars breed freely, and a pair of boars can rapidly grow to a large family. Boars are a particular nuisance to farmers, as they break into food stores and root through gardens to sate their hunger.

action->Daeodon Charge.name: Daeodon Charge
action->Daeodon Charge.description: The daeodon Strides twice then makes a tusk Strike. As long as it moved at least 20 feet, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its attack roll. A Medium or smaller creature struck by this attack must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:22] save or be knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} by the force of the blow.

Empowered Deskari Effigy.name: Empowered Deskari Effigy
Empowered Deskari Effigy.descriptionHazard: A statuette of the deceased demon lord creates frightening illusions of insect swarms.
Empowered Deskari Effigy.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:20] (expert) or @Check[religion|dc:20] (trained) to deactivate the effigy or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 23) to dispel the statuette
Empowered Deskari Effigy.reset: 1 minute as the illusory insects harass intruders before scuttling into the earth.

action->False Swarm.name: False Swarm
action->False Swarm.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 30 feet of the hidden entrance without saying the cultists' password

Effect A swarm of illusionary insects bursts out of the grass in a @Template[cone|distance:60] from the Deskari effigy and seemingly crawl over the intruders, shrieking incessantly. All creatures in the area must make a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save or become temporarily @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute (deafened and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute on a critical failure).

Empowered Shadow of Sezruth.name: Empowered Shadow of Sezruth
Empowered Shadow of Sezruth.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Hatred of Beauty.name: Hatred of Beauty
action->Hatred of Beauty.description:
While aghashes hate all mortals, they particularly despise beautiful objects and beautiful or charismatic mortals. When not in physical peril, an aghash is compelled to destroy art and other works of beauty. An aghash can't enter an area of pristine beauty without first marring it in some way.

Given a choice, an aghash attacks a foe with the highest Charisma score first. If barred from doing so by force or some magical effect, they take @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage at the end of their turn.

action->Cursed Gaze.name: Cursed Gaze
action->Cursed Gaze.description:
The aghash fixes their gaze on one creature they can see within 20 feet. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage and becomes either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (the aghash's choice).

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

action->Sandstorm.name: Sandstorm
action->Sandstorm.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The aghash creates a temporary sandstorm in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] that lasts for 1 minute.

Creatures within the emanation take a -4 circumstance penalty to Perception checks and must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save. On a failure, they're forced to hold their breath or else they start suffocating. A creature within the sandstorm at the end of its turn takes @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage.

Divs are immune to all effects of an aghash's sandstorm.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.f8rncEs06bqcn3LZ]{Effect: Sandstorm}

effect->Spell Effect: Mystic Armor.name: Spell Effect: Mystic Armor
effect->Spell Effect: Mystic Armor.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aAbfKn8maGjJjk2W]{Mystic Armor}

You ward yourself with shimmering magical energy, gaining a +1 item bonus to AC and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. While wearing mystic armor, you use your unarmored proficiency to calculate your AC.

action->Slip from the Back.name: Slip from the Back
action->Slip from the Back.description: Firmagor directs his gang members to concentrate their actions to defend him. Until the start of his next turn, when an attack against Firmagor misses, Firmagor or another friendly creature within 30 feet may use their reaction to Stride.

action->Sneaky Cast.name: Sneaky Cast
action->Sneaky Cast.description: Foes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Firmagor take a –2 circumstance penalty on their saving throws against his spells.

Enraged Shurrizih.name: Enraged Shurrizih
Enraged Shurrizih.publicNotes: Regarded as the progenitors of geniekind, janns hold a position of esteem above the genies tied to specific planes. They possess an inborn ability to grant wishes, which the other branches of geniekind lack and greatly envy. Nomadic jann shuyookhs rarely hold court, preferring to gather only when the need arises to perform great deeds. Lesser janns respect and venerate these leaders for their wisdom and total dedication to preserving the honor and reputation of their people. A jann shuyookh reads portents and omens when dealing with duplicitous mortals.

spell->Interplanar Teleport (At Will; To.name: Interplanar Teleport (At Will; To Astral Plane, Elemental Planes, or the Universe only)

action->Commanding Presence.name: Commanding Presence
action->Commanding Presence.description:
20 feet.

A creature that enters the aura must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:19] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure), and is then temporarily immune for 1 minute. A genie (with the exception of another jann) takes a –4 circumstance penalty to their save.

action->Elemental Resistance.name: Elemental Resistance
action->Elemental Resistance.description: The jann shuyookh's elemental resistance applies to cold, electricity, and fire damage, as well as all damage from elemental sources (including environmental damage from the elemental planes and damage from anything with the air, earth, fire, metal, water, or wood trait).

action->All Made One.name: All Made One
action->All Made One.description:
The jann shuyookh calls upon all the elements that make up their being and chooses one. They gain an additional arcane spell they can cast at will and empower their Strikes with the element, dealing an extra 1d6 damage of the listed type. These benefits last until the shuyookh uses this ability again.

  • Air: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9AAkVUCwF6WVNNY2]{Lightning Bolt}, 1d6 electricity;
  • Earth: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vh1RpbWfqdNC4L3P]{One with Stone}, 1d6 bludgeoning;
  • Fire: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball}, 1d6 fire;
  • Metal: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.3A3ueS9Q0s3U8KXE]{Noxious Metals}, 1d6 electricity;
  • Water: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LNOwaJAkCfsgTKgV]{Wall of Water}, 1d6 bludgeoning;
  • Wood: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KsWhliKfUs3IpW3c]{Wall of Thorns}, 1d6 piercing.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
The jann transforms into a Small or Medium elemental or animal. This doesn't affect the gennayn's statistics, but it could change the damage type of their Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Entodemonologist.name: Entodemonologist
Entodemonologist.publicNotes:
Demonologists can pull a creature from the Abyss and bend it to their will... for a time.

Those initiated into the hidden truths and forbidden secrets of the world are forever transformed-or so they claim. To the cynical, a mystic is nothing more than a charlatan or zealot. Others profess to sense an aura around such luminaries and treat them with reverence, lest they offend some harbinger of unspeakable doom.

armor->Scholarly Robes.name: Scholarly Robes
armor->Scholarly Robes.description: Explorer's clothing is sturdy enough that it can be reinforced to protect you, even though it isn't a suit of armor. It comes in many forms, though the most common sorts look like clerical vestments, monk's garments, or wizard's robes, as members of all three classes are likely to avoid wearing armor.

equipment->Spell Component Pouch.name: Spell Component Pouch
equipment->Spell Component Pouch.description: This pouch contains material components for those spells that require them. Though the components are used up over time, you can refill spent components during your daily preparations.

equipment->Spellbook.name: Spellbook
equipment->Spellbook.description: A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

Exhausted Raja Rakshasa.name: Exhausted Raja Rakshasa
Exhausted Raja Rakshasa.publicNotes:
When not disguised as a humanoid, the raja rakshasa has the head of an animal. The hands of a raja rakshasa are more subtly unsettling, for the fingers of these fiends bend outward, away from the palms.

More than any other types of rakshasa, rajas scoff at religion. They understand the power of the divine, yet they view themselves as the only things worthy of worship from mortal creatures; not even their own immortals are deemed deserving of such glorification. Raja rakshasas often form close-knit families that work together to bring down mortal cities or to rule them from the shadows within. Such families of rakshasas often incorporate other breeds of the fiend, often using dandasukas as favored servants or stealthy spies. Even though a raja family works together to achieve a shared goal, infighting and treachery among their own is a constant threat.

Rakshasas are evil spirits that cloak themselves in the guises of humanoid creatures, that they might walk unseen among their prey. They embody what is taboo among most societies, and in the shape of those they seek to defile, rakshasas gorge themselves on these hideous acts. A wide range of rakshasas exist; presented below are the diminutive, sinister dandasuka rakshasa and the infamous raja rakshasa, who are the most widespread and commonly encountered of these fiends.
Exhausted Raja Rakshasa.allSavesBonus: +2 status to all saves vs. magic, +3 status to all saves vs. divine magic

weapon->Naval Pike.name: Naval Pike
weapon->Naval Pike.description: A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.

action->Leader's Command.name: Leader's Command
action->Leader's Command.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The leader orders an ally to attack or to get in position. Until the end of the ally's next turn, they gain the leader's choice of a +2 status bonus to attack rolls or a +10-foot status bonus to their Speeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Df5CnXnVHC1mVINK]{Effect: Leader's Command}

action->Pike and Strike.name: Pike and Strike
action->Pike and Strike.description: The leader Strikes with their naval pike. If this Strike hits, the leader can either move the target 5 feet within the pike's reach or make a sap Strike against the target without increasing their multiple attack penalty until after the sap Strike.

weapon->Acid Flask (Moderate).name: Acid Flask (Moderate)
weapon->Acid Flask (Moderate).description:
Activate A Strike

This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, 2d6 persistent acid damage, and 2 acid splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Moderate).name: Alchemist's Fire (Moderate)
weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Moderate).description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 2d8 fire damage, 2 persistent fire damage, and 2 fire splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

action->Sacred Fire.name: Sacred Fire
action->Sacred Fire.description: Any non-consumable weapon the cultist wields gains the effects of the flaming rune in addition to a +1 striking weapon rune.

action->Sacred Sabotage.name: Sacred Sabotage
action->Sacred Sabotage.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The cultist of Sezelrian can draw a poison and quickly apply it to the weapon or unarmed attack of an adjacent ally.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The tough robber leads an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Stunning Critical.name: Stunning Critical
action->Stunning Critical.description: When the experienced robber deals damage on a critical hit, the target is knocked back 10 feet and must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. On a critical failure, the target also falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Extremely Helpful Wisp Swarm.name: Extremely Helpful Wisp Swarm
Extremely Helpful Wisp Swarm.descriptionHazard: Hovering amid the branches of an acacia tree, a swarm of wood wisps attempt to gather the papers that have been caught in its leaves and thorns.
Extremely Helpful Wisp Swarm.disable: Diplomacy @Check[diplomacy|dc:23] (trained) to make a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request}, @Check[athletics|dc:23] (trained) to climb the tree and help gather papers manually, or @Check[performance|dc:25] (trained) to demonstrate how the wisps can help without destroying the papers.
Extremely Helpful Wisp Swarm.routine: (3 actions) The wisp swarm loses one action for each successful check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{disable} it. The wisps swarm to work on each of their actions, making a headbutt Strike against any creature within 10 feet of the tree and destroying [[/br 2d4 #Pages]] pages of notes.
Extremely Helpful Wisp Swarm.stealth: (trained) to notice the creatures hovering in the trees

action->Willing Wisps.name: Willing Wisps
action->Willing Wisps.description:
Trigger A creature comes within 10 feet of the tree or directly addresses the wood wisps

Effect The wood wisp swarm animatedly tries to help the group gather the papers, destroying [[/br 2d4 #Pages]] pages, and then rolls initiative.

action->Flee.name: Flee
action->Flee.description:
Trigger The hermit rat's jar is destroyed

Effect The hermit rat Strides up to its Speed without triggering reactions.

action->Kimchi Jar Shell.name: Kimchi Jar Shell
action->Kimchi Jar Shell.description: The hermit rat's kimchi jar shell has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once hermit rat is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its kimchi jar shell breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 13

action->Ram.name: Ram
action->Ram.description: The hermit rat rolls in its vessel up to its full movement, ramming into a target in its path and dealing @Damage[(1d6+2)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save).

Fey Table Hound.name: Fey Table Hound
Fey Table Hound.speedsDetails: unfettered movement while in the forest

effect->Spell Effect: Mystic Armor.description:
Granted by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aAbfKn8maGjJjk2W]{Mystic Armor}

You ward yourself with shimmering magical energy, gaining a +1 item bonus to AC and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. While wearing mystic armor, you use your unarmored proficiency to calculate your AC.

action->Slip from the Back.name: Slip from the Back
action->Slip from the Back.description: Firmagor directs his gang members to concentrate their actions to defend him. Until the start of his next turn, when an attack against Firmagor misses, Firmagor or another friendly creature within 30 feet may use their reaction to Stride.

action->Sneaky Cast.name: Sneaky Cast
action->Sneaky Cast.description: Foes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Firmagor take a –2 circumstance penalty on their saving throws against his spells.

Flaming Sphere Rune.name: Flaming Sphere Rune
Flaming Sphere Rune.descriptionHazard: An invisible rune creates an invisible, spherical magical sensor with a 5-foot radius.
Flaming Sphere Rune.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:18] (trained) to erase the rune without triggering the sensor, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2rd level; counteract DC 16) to counteract the rune

action->Flaming Sphere.name: Flaming Sphere
action->Flaming Sphere.description:
Trigger A living creature touches the sensor area.

Effect The rune detonates creating a flaming sphere in the sensor area. This is a 2nd-rank flaming sphere spell that deals @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save).

Flaming Sphere Rune (5-6).name: Flaming Sphere Rune (5-6)
Flaming Sphere Rune (5-6).descriptionHazard: An invisible rune creates an invisible, spherical magical sensor with a 5-foot radius.
Flaming Sphere Rune (5-6).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:21] (trained) to erase the rune without triggering the sensor, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2rd level; counteract DC 18) to counteract the rune

action->Flaming Sphere.name: Flaming Sphere
action->Flaming Sphere.description:
Trigger A living creature touches the sensor area.

Effect The rune detonates creating a flaming sphere in the sensor area. This is a 3nd-rank flaming sphere spell that deals @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save).

Full Head of Steam.name: Full Head of Steam
Full Head of Steam.descriptionHazard: Hidden vents emit scalding hot steam made from a particularly acrid solution, irritating the eyes and throat of anyone who inhales it.
Full Head of Steam.disable: @Check[thievery|name:disable|dc:33] (expert) to block a vent, or @Check[crafting|name:disable|dc:31] (expert) to disable the heating element within the vent that turns the liquid into steam
Full Head of Steam.reset: The steam vents cease to operate 1 minute after all creatures have left the area and go into a maintenance cycle for 1 hour. After this time, they can be triggered again.
Full Head of Steam.routine: (4 actions) Each of the four steam vents uses a single action each to emit superheated steam, which spreads for 60 feet along the wall from its location and extends out from the wall by 30 feet, dealing @Damage[(2d12+13)[untyped]] damage to each creature in their range (@Check[fortitude|dc:29] save). For each disabled vent, the trap loses 1 action each turn.
Full Head of Steam.stealth: (trained); @Check[perception|dc:32] (expert) to find the precise location of the steam vents

action->Billowing Steam.name: Billowing Steam
action->Billowing Steam.description:
Trigger A creature enters the area of the trap

Effect All four vents rapidly heat and let out steam for 5 seconds, filling room with a painfully acrid smell. Each creature in the room must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:29] save, and the trap then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}, and, struck by a coughing fit, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Germinated Mandragora.name: Germinated Mandragora
Germinated Mandragora.publicNotes:
A mandragora looks like a freshly pulled tuber that has grown into the malformed shape of a child with a grotesque face and hideously bloated body. These insidious little plants typically form when a mandrake root is watered with a demon's blood. Upon absorbing the otherworldly properties of the demon's blood, the root animates and is forced to seek out blood to feast from, lest it die of thirst.

Always famished and in search for sustenance, mandragoras live haunted, pained lives and perform vile and desperate acts to acquire the blood they crave. While they prefer magically infused blood such as that of unicorns, fey, or sorcerers, and they can also feed off of potions, alchemical bombs, and other magical elixirs, a mandragora can subsist on the blood of non-magical creatures. They find the flavor of mundane blood to be bland and bitter, and they do not blanch at voicing these complaints to the creatures from which they drink.

While the typical mandragora is the size of a human child, some of these evil plants continue to grow and grow, reaching sizes more comparable to those of giants. Sometimes as they grow, they form additional limbs or rudimentary faces, eventually transforming into truly hideous mockeries of the human form.

action->Blood Scent.name: Blood Scent
action->Blood Scent.description: A germinated mandragora can smell creatures with blood as an imprecise scent at a range of 30 feet, and it can smell demons, fey, and sorcerers with blood as a precise sense at a range of 30 feet.

action->Vulnerability to Supernatural Da.name: Vulnerability to Supernatural Darkness
action->Vulnerability to Supernatural Da.description: Whenever a germinated mandragora begins its turn in an area of magical darkness, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} on that turn.

action->Blood Drain.name: Blood Drain
action->Blood Drain.description:
Requirements The germinated mandragora has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect The germinated mandragora drains blood from the creature it has grabbed, dealing @Damage[1d6[untyped]] damage. If the creature is a demon, fey, or sorcerer, the germinated mandragora gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its blood drained by a germinated mandragora is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing of any kind or amount.

action->Mandragora Venom.name: Mandragora Venom
action->Mandragora Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:19]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

action->Piercing Shriek.name: Piercing Shriek
action->Piercing Shriek.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The germinated mandragora emits an unsettling shriek. Each non-mandragora creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:23] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is sickened 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. As long as the creature remains sickened, this slowed condition value can't be reduced below 1.

Ghessa.name: Ghessa
Ghessa.publicNotes:
A monk who violated their monastic vows in life might arise after death to become an undead horror known as a kurobozu. These predators feast upon the breath of mortals, creeping on twisted limbs into bedrooms to steal the life from sleeping victims. This act of feeding leaves its mark on the victim in the form of a vile scent of rot on the victim's breath and a debilitating disease that eventually results in exhaustion and finally death.

Kurobozus retain echoes of their ascetic training, enabling them to suck the breath from debilitated foes in the midst of battle. Their malevolent cunning combined with ascetic discipline helps them concoct elaborate and lengthy schemes to enact their jealous revenge. Few kurobozus are convincing enough to persuade their onetime allies to break their own oaths, but this doesn't stop them from making the attempt.

equipment->Tool.name: Tool
equipment->Tool.description: This entry is a catchall for basic hand tools that don't have a specific adventuring purpose. A hoe, shovel, or sledgehammer is a long tool, and a hand drill, ice hook, or trowel is a short tool. A tool can usually be used as an improvised weapon, dealing 1d4 damage. The GM determines the damage type that's appropriate or adjusts the damage if needed.

consumable->Oil of Unlife (Lesser).name: Oil of Unlife (Lesser)
consumable->Oil of Unlife (Lesser).description:
Activate 1 Interact

This thin, black liquid imparts a bone-deep chill while rapidly repairing an undead creature's physical or spiritual form. When you dash oil of unlife onto an undead creature, or a living creature with void healing, the oil absorbs quickly into its body, and the creature regains @Damage[(2d8+5)[healing]] Hit Points. You can pour oil of unlife on an incorporeal undead; in this case, the creature absorbs the oil into itself.

consumable->Wand of Animate Dead (Level.name: Wand of Animate Dead (Level 3)
consumable->Wand of Animate Dead (Level.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9WGeBwIIbbUuWKq0]{Summon Undead}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated level.

Craft Requirements Supply a listed-level casting of the spell.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

action->Black Apoxia.name: Black Apoxia
action->Black Apoxia.description:
The target can't recover from the fatigued condition caused by black apoxia until the disease is cured

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:24]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and fatigued (1 day)

Stage 4 dead

action->Brawling Critical.name: Brawling Critical
action->Brawling Critical.description: When the kurobozu scores a critical hit with an unarmed attack, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn.

action->Sagebane.name: Sagebane
action->Sagebane.description: When the kurobozu damages a living creature with an unarmed Strike, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute. Further damage dealt by the kurobozu resets the duration to 1 minute and increases the stupefied value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4}.

action->Steal Breath.name: Steal Breath
action->Steal Breath.description:
Requirements The kurobozu is adjacent to a living creature that is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}

Effect The kurobozu leans over and sucks the breath from the target, who must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save. Regardless of the result, the creature is exposed to black apoxia and its breath reeks of carrion for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature can't speak for 1 minute.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and can't speak for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, plus the creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} and begins suffocating.

action->Stunning Flurry.name: Stunning Flurry
action->Stunning Flurry.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The kurobozu makes two unarmed Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses, and the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19|traits:incapacitation] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure); this save has the incapacitation trait.

Ghessa (5-6).name: Ghessa (5-6)
Ghessa (5-6).publicNotes:
A monk who violated their monastic vows in life might arise after death to become an undead horror known as a kurobozu. These predators feast upon the breath of mortals, creeping on twisted limbs into bedrooms to steal the life from sleeping victims. This act of feeding leaves its mark on the victim in the form of a vile scent of rot on the victim's breath and a debilitating disease that eventually results in exhaustion and finally death.

Kurobozus retain echoes of their ascetic training, enabling them to suck the breath from debilitated foes in the midst of battle. Their malevolent cunning combined with ascetic discipline helps them concoct elaborate and lengthy schemes to enact their jealous revenge. Few kurobozus are convincing enough to persuade their onetime allies to break their own oaths, but this doesn't stop them from making the attempt.

equipment->Tool.name: Tool
equipment->Tool.description: This entry is a catchall for basic hand tools that don't have a specific adventuring purpose. A hoe, shovel, or sledgehammer is a long tool, and a hand drill, ice hook, or trowel is a short tool. A tool can usually be used as an improvised weapon, dealing 1d4 damage. The GM determines the damage type that's appropriate or adjusts the damage if needed.

consumable->Oil of Unlife (Lesser).name: Oil of Unlife (Lesser)
consumable->Oil of Unlife (Lesser).description:
Activate 1 Interact

This thin, black liquid imparts a bone-deep chill while rapidly repairing an undead creature's physical or spiritual form. When you dash oil of unlife onto an undead creature, or a living creature with void healing, the oil absorbs quickly into its body, and the creature regains @Damage[(2d8+5)[healing]] Hit Points. You can pour oil of unlife on an incorporeal undead; in this case, the creature absorbs the oil into itself.

consumable->Wand of Animate Dead (Level.name: Wand of Animate Dead (Level 5)
consumable->Wand of Animate Dead (Level.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9WGeBwIIbbUuWKq0]{Summon Undead}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated level.

Craft Requirements Supply a listed-level casting of the spell.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

action->Black Apoxia.name: Black Apoxia
action->Black Apoxia.description:
The target can't recover from the fatigued condition caused by black apoxia until the disease is cured

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:24]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and fatigued (1 day)

Stage 4 dead

action->Brawling Critical.name: Brawling Critical
action->Brawling Critical.description: When the kurobozu scores a critical hit with an unarmed attack, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn.

Success The creature can't speak for 1 minute.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} and can't speak for 1 minute.

equipment->Gardening Tools.name: Gardening Tools
equipment->Gardening Tools.description: This entry is a catchall for basic hand tools that don't have a specific adventuring purpose. A hoe, shovel, or sledgehammer is a long tool, and a hand drill, ice hook, or trowel is a short tool. A tool can usually be used as an improvised weapon, dealing 1d4 damage. The GM determines the damage type that's appropriate or adjusts the damage if needed.

action->Plant Empathy.name: Plant Empathy
action->Plant Empathy.description: The ghostknife gardener can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} and make very simple requests of plants.

action->Decompose.name: Decompose
action->Decompose.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Void energy seeps out of the ghostknife gardener, decaying everything within a @Template[emanation|distance:5] and causing plants and foliage to age and decompose. Natural difficult terrain is destroyed, and creatures in the area with the plant or wood trait take @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:16|basic]).

action->Envenom.name: Envenom
action->Envenom.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Using either saliva or blood, the infiltrator applies vishkanyan venom to one weapon they're holding. To use their blood, they must be injured, or they can deal themselves @Damage[1[slashing]] damage as part of the action.

action->Flexible.name: Flexible
action->Flexible.description: The infiltrator is adept at dealing with tight situations. They have a +1 circumstance bonus to checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.

action->Proficient Poisoner.name: Proficient Poisoner
action->Proficient Poisoner.description: The infiltrator doesn't lose the poison on a weapon due to a critically failed Strike.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The infiltrator deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Vishkanyan Venom.name: Vishkanyan Venom
action->Vishkanyan Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage, off-guard, and a –5-foot penalty to Speed (1 round)

action->Flee.name: Flee
action->Flee.description:
Trigger The hermit rat's jar is destroyed

Effect The hermit rat Strides up to its Speed without triggering reactions.

action->Kimchi Jar Shell.name: Kimchi Jar Shell
action->Kimchi Jar Shell.description: The hermit rat's kimchi jar shell has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once hermit rat is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its kimchi jar shell breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 14

action->Brine Burn.name: Brine Burn
action->Brine Burn.description: A creature that takes damage from the hermit rat's jaw attack must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:15] Save. On a failure, the wound burns from spicy kimchi brine and they take an additional @Damage[1d4[acid]] damage.

action->Ram.name: Ram
action->Ram.description: The hermit rat rolls in its vessel up to its full movement, ramming into a target in its path and dealing @Damage[(1d6+3)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save).

action->Skittish.name: Skittish
action->Skittish.description:
Trigger The giant mouse is hit with a melee attack

Effect The giant mouse takes a step after the effects of the triggering attack are resolved.

action->Skittish.name: Skittish
action->Skittish.description:
Trigger The giant-er mouse is hit with a melee attack

Effect The giant-er mouse takes a step after the effects of the triggering attack are resolved.

Greater Blood Shadow Mirror.name: Greater Blood Shadow Mirror
Greater Blood Shadow Mirror.descriptionHazard: A dark shape moves in the surface of an ornate mirror, its eyes wide as blood seeps down its tormented face.
Greater Blood Shadow Mirror.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20] (trained) to fully cover the mirror or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 22) to dispel the mirror.
Greater Blood Shadow Mirror.reset: 1 minute if no fresh blood has been spilled.
Greater Blood Shadow Mirror.routine:
(2 actions; arcane, mental) The bloody figure in the mirror transforms to reflect a creature within 30 feet. The reflection bleeds profusely from the eyes, nose, and mouth, and the reflected creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21|traits:arcane,mental] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature bleeds from their mouth or nose.

Failure The creature bleeds from their eyes, mouth, and nose, and takes @Damage[2d8[persistent,bleed]] damage.

Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.
Greater Blood Shadow Mirror.stealth: (trained); DC 0 to notice the mirror without noting it is a trap

action->Bloody Glare.name: Bloody Glare
action->Bloody Glare.description:
Trigger A creature spills blood in the room

Effect A ghastly figure of blood appears in the mirror's surface, forcing all creatures who can see it to attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save. The trap then rolls initiative.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature bleeds from their nose and mouth.

Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

action->Hydration.name: Hydration
action->Hydration.description: Azarketi must regularly submerge themselves in water to rehydrate their water-acclimated skin. After the first 24 hours outside of water, they gain a –1 status penalty to Fortitude saves as their skin cracks and their gills become painful. After 48 hours, they struggle to breathe air and begin to suffocate until returned to water.

action->Submerged Stealth.name: Submerged Stealth
action->Submerged Stealth.description: While submerged in water, an azarketi ruffian gains a +2 circumstance bonus on their Stealth check, indicated above.

weapon->Chitin Dagger.name: Chitin Dagger
weapon->Chitin Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

weapon->Rotcarver Scythe.name: Rotcarver Scythe
weapon->Rotcarver Scythe.description: Derived from a farming tool used to mow down long grains and cereals, this weapon has a long wooden shaft with protruding handles, capped with a curved blade set at a right angle.

action->Breath Pollen.name: Breath Pollen
action->Breath Pollen.description: The wood scamp breathes choking pollen in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic]; creatures who don't need to breathe are immune). The wood scamp can't use Breathe Pollen again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breathe Pollen]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Thorn Puncture.name: Thorn Puncture
action->Thorn Puncture.description: The wood scamp breaks off one of its thornlike claws in the target's skin, dealing @Damage[1[bleed]]{1 persistent bleed} damage until the thorn is removed, which requires an Interact action. This damage is cumulative with each thorn caught in a creature's skin.

Helpful Wisp Swarm.name: Helpful Wisp Swarm
Helpful Wisp Swarm.descriptionHazard: Hovering amid the branches of an acacia tree, a swarm of wood wisps attempt to gather the papers that have been caught in its leaves and thorns.
Helpful Wisp Swarm.disable: Diplomacy @Check[diplomacy|dc:21] (trained) to make a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request}, @Check[athletics|dc:21] (trained) to climb the tree and help gather papers manually, or @Check[performance|dc:23] (trained) to demonstrate how the wisps can help without destroying the papers.
Helpful Wisp Swarm.routine: (3 actions) The wisp swarm loses one action for each successful check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{disable} it. The wisps swarm to work on each of their actions, making a headbutt Strike against any creature within 10 feet of the tree and destroying [[/br 2d4 #Pages]] pages of notes.
Helpful Wisp Swarm.stealth: (trained) to notice the creatures hovering in the trees

action->Willing Wisps.name: Willing Wisps
action->Willing Wisps.description:
Trigger A creature comes within 10 feet of the tree or directly addresses the wood wisps

Effect The wood wisp swarm animatedly tries to help the group gather the papers, destroying [[/br 2d4 #Pages]] pages, and then rolls initiative.

action->Flee.description:
Trigger The hermit rat's jar is destroyed

Effect The hermit rat Strides up to its Speed without triggering reactions.

action->Kimchi Jar Shell.description: The hermit rat's kimchi jar shell has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once hermit rat is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its kimchi jar shell breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 12.

action->Ram.name: Ram
action->Ram.description: The hermit rat rolls in its vessel up to its full movement, ramming into a target in its path and dealing @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save).

Hexed Chest.name: Hexed Chest
Hexed Chest.descriptionHazard: The magical runes glow at any attempt to open this chest.
Hexed Chest.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:19] (trained) to safely scratch out the runes or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd rank; counteract DC 17) to counteract the runes.
Hexed Chest.stealth: (trained) to notice the runes carved into the lid.

action->Curse of Itchiness.name: Curse of Itchiness
action->Curse of Itchiness.description:
Trigger A creature opens the chest without speaking the command word

Effect The curse gives the target the sensation that countless ants are biting and stinging them for an entire day. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20] save.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 24 hours.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 24 hours.

Hidden Current.name: Hidden Current
Hidden Current.publicNotes:
Often considered cousins of phades, veiled currents are loose veils of wind who catch prey within their folds.

Many elementals that roam the Plane of Air embody the mercurial formlessness and chaos of tumultuous storms.

Tempestuous Spirits

Air elementals are often flighty contrarians, often more concerned with bringing about change than with the specific changes they enact. Art and writing created by such elementals is exceptionally rare, as they usually destroy their projects once the challenge and excitement of completing them fades.

Invisible Courtiers

Formless and invisible elementals are the favored children of Hshurha, the air elementals' mother goddess. They receive favorable treatment in her realm, Verglas Precessional, where they serve as trusted advisors, emissaries to other planes, and members of her personal retinue, in addition to performing clandestine tasks the goddess wishes to keep hidden.

action->Echolocation.name: Echolocation
action->Echolocation.description: A bat can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

action->Treasure Toss.name: Treasure Toss
action->Treasure Toss.description: The hoarding bat scoops up a rock or nearby item and throws it at an enemy within 30 feet. The targeted creature must succeed on a @Check[reflex|dc:17] save or take @Damage[(1d6+2)[bludgeoning]] damage.

action->Snatch Up.name: Snatch Up
action->Snatch Up.description:
Trigger A creature leaves the swarm's space

Effect The creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save to escape the swarm's space or they are picked up and thrown 5 feet, taking @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

action->Echolocation.name: Echolocation
action->Echolocation.description: A bat can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

action->Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
action->Swarming Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[1d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save).

Hound Echo.name: Hound Echo
Hound Echo.publicNotes:
Lean and athirst, the hounds of Tindalos are drawn to those who tamper with the flow of time, travel through time, or use magic or rare alchemical drugs to send their thoughts or perception back or forward in time. Powerful spellcasters can draw them from the Dimension of Time via rare rituals, but doing so attracts the hounds' ire, so few who traffic in such rituals live long enough to spread their knowledge. While the hounds possess great cunning and cruel intellect, they rarely interact with other creatures-other than to hunt and destroy those who have attracted their unblinking attention.

Once a hound catches scent of a mortal to hunt, it calls others of its ilk. The pack then pursues its victim through all space and time until it catches, slays and devours them. Those pursued can escape only by avoiding all angles, as hounds of Tindalos could step through them from nothingness at any time.

action->Churning Gaze.name: Churning Gaze
action->Churning Gaze.description: 30 feet. The hound echo's eyes glow balefully, causing the internal organs of a creature that meets its awful gaze to churn and spasm. When a creature ends its turn in the aura's emanation, it must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). A creature that critically succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

action->Otherworldly Mind.name: Otherworldly Mind
action->Otherworldly Mind.description: Whenever a creature targets the hound with a mental effect, that creature takes @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:18|basic] save). On a failure, it also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Vulnerable to Curved Space.name: Vulnerable to Curved Space
action->Vulnerable to Curved Space.description:
When a hound echo is not adjacent to a structural angle of 90° (or more acute), its resistance to physical damage is suppressed and it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. It can't recover from this sickened condition, but the condition ends automatically once the hound is again adjacent to a suitable angle.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.V60TWjo1G1r5ZtPM]{Effect: Vulnerable to Curved Space}

action->Limited Angled Entry.name: Limited Angled Entry
action->Limited Angled Entry.description:
The hound echo casts a 4th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate} spell, but it must transport itself into a space it can see that is adjacent to an angle of 90° (or more acute) in the structure or environment around it. For example, it could teleport to a space adjacent to a wall (using the angle between the wall and floor) or a corner in a room, or adjacent to a sizable tree growing straight up out of the ground, but not to a flat plain or a room with only curved corners and edges. It can't use Limited Angled Entry again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Limited Angled Entry]]{1d4 rounds}.

Once per day, the hound can use this ability to plane shift to or from the Dimension of Time, with the same restrictions on what angles it can appear next to.

action->Attach.name: Attach
action->Attach.description: When a hyacinth lamprey hits a target larger than itself, its circular rows of teeth attach it to that creature. This is similar to grabbing the creature, but the lamprey moves with that creature rather than holding it in place. The lamprey is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while attached. If the lamprey is killed or pushed away while attached to a creature it has drained water from, that creature takes @Damage[1[bleed]]{1 persistent bleed} damage. Escaping the attach or removing the lamprey in other ways doesn't cause bleed damage.

action->Drain Water.name: Drain Water
action->Drain Water.description:
Requirements The hyacinth lamprey is attached to a creature

Effect The hyacinth lamprey drains water from the creature it is attached to. This deals [[/r 1d4]] damage, and the hyacinth lamprey gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its water drained by a hyacinth lamprey is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing (of any kind or amount).

Jamimpi.name: Jamimpi
Jamimpi.publicNotes:
The opposite of dark nagas in many ways, guardian nagas are benevolent and wise protectors of places of great natural or supernatural significance: ancient oak groves, forgotten holy temples, and vaults of sacred power are just a few examples of locations that these nagas protect. Guardian nagas believe that the beautiful elements of the cosmos are worthy of protection and that devotion to such a grand effort is its own reward. A guardian naga may join a group with similar values, such as a sect of priests or monks, to aid it in its holy endeavors and to exchange knowledge of the heavens.

Guardian nagas usually encourage their young, upon reaching adulthood, to depart the nest and seek out their own natural wonders or ancient ruins to protect. Sometimes generations of guardian nagas might guard the same place, passing the honor of such care from parent to child. In such cases, the parent nagas aim to have at least one of their children elect to stay behind and become the guardian of their ancestral ward, giving the parents the peace of mind that the site they protect will continue to be guarded by their descendants.

It is difficult for many societies that vilify serpents or see them as symbols of evil to accept the fact that guardian nagas are benevolent and kindly. Fortunately for these people, guardian nagas are also patient and understanding, and see encounters with such societies as opportunities to educate and expand worldviews.

Nagas are serpentine beings with magical powers and keen, nearly inscrutable intellects. Physically, they resemble massive snakes with eerie visages that resemble those of humans. Nagas use their innate magic and poisonous fangs to keep all but the most stalwart foes at bay. Beyond the natural weapons they use to ward away foes, little is understood of the naga's unsettling physiology.

Nagas are intelligent creatures with powerful needs to pursue, be they the accumulation of knowledge, the collection of rare art, or the rule of an entire nation. On Golarion, the nation of Nagajor is one such society-an entire empire ruled by nagas and populated by reptilian humanoids who serve their naga rulers with a patriotic pride that borders on worship.

Still, most adventurers interact with nagas on a much smaller scale, encountering them as dangerous guardians in remote locations or not-so-abandoned ruins. In many cases, these nagas have heard of distant Nagajor, but they are usually unwilling to abandon their own pursuits to seek out a land where they might be worshipped as gods.

weapon->Tanglefoot Bag (Lesser).name: Tanglefoot Bag (Lesser)
weapon->Tanglefoot Bag (Lesser).description:
Activate 1 Strike

A tanglefoot bag is filled with sticky substances. When you hit a creature with a tanglefoot bag, that creature takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute. The Escape DC is 17.

On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to Fly again for 1 round. Tanglefoot bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water.

The target can end any effects by Escaping or spending a total of 3 actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These Interact actions don't have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well.

consumable->Healing Potion (Lesser).name: Healing Potion (Lesser)
consumable->Healing Potion (Lesser).description: A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain @Damage[(2d8+5)[healing]] Hit Points.

action->Deny Advantage.name: Deny Advantage
action->Deny Advantage.description: Krosovahn Mendesil isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 5th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using surprise attack.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
action->Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, if Krosovahn Mendesil rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures who haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Krosovahn Mendesil.

action->You're Next.name: You're Next
action->You're Next.description:
Trigger Krosovahn Mendesil reduces an enemy to 0 Hit Points

Effect After downing the foe, Krosovahn Mendesil menacingly reminds another foe that he's coming after them next. Krosovahn Mendesil attempts an Intimidation check with a +2 circumstance bonus to [[/act demoralize options=youre-next]] a single creature that he can see and that can see him.

action->Brutal Rally.name: Brutal Rally
action->Brutal Rally.description:
Trigger Krosovahn Mendesil rolls a critical hit against a creature

Effect All allies that can see Krosovahn Mendesil gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls until the start of Krosovahn Mendesil's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7x0O2GqWBJiAk5PF]{Effect: Brutal Rally}

action->Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
action->Quick Draw.description: Krosovahn Mendesil Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Krosovahn Mendesil deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures

weapon->Tanglefoot Bag (Lesser).name: Tanglefoot Bag (Lesser)
weapon->Tanglefoot Bag (Lesser).description:
Activate 1 Strike

A tanglefoot bag is filled with sticky substances. When you hit a creature with a tanglefoot bag, that creature takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute. The Escape DC is 17.

On a critical hit, a creature in contact with a solid surface becomes stuck to the surface and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round, and a creature flying via wings has its wings tangled, causing it to fall safely to the ground and become unable to Fly again for 1 round. Tanglefoot bags are not effective when used on a creature that is in water.

The target can end any effects by Escaping or spending a total of 3 actions to carefully remove the sticky substances. These Interact actions don't have to be consecutive, and other creatures can provide the actions as well.

action->Deny Advantage.name: Deny Advantage
