action->Evasion.name: Evasion
action->Evasion.description: When Krosovahn Mendesil rolls a success on a Reflex save, he gets a critical success instead.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
action->Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, if Krosovahn Mendesil rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures who haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Krosovahn Mendesil.

action->You're Next.name: You're Next
action->You're Next.description:
Trigger Krosovahn Mendesil reduces an enemy to 0 Hit Points

Effect After downing the foe, Krosovahn Mendesil menacingly reminds another foe that he's coming after them next. Krosovahn Mendesil attempts an Intimidation check with a +2 circumstance bonus to [[/act demoralize options=youre-next]] a single creature that he can see and that can see him.

action->Brutal Rally.name: Brutal Rally
action->Brutal Rally.description:
Trigger Krosovahn Mendesil rolls a critical hit against a creature

Effect All allies that can see Krosovahn Mendesil gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls until the start of Krosovahn Mendesil's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7x0O2GqWBJiAk5PF]{Effect: Brutal Rally}

action->Gang Up.name: Gang Up
action->Gang Up.description: Any enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against Krosovahn Mendesil's melee attacks due to flanking as long as the enemy is within melee reach of both Krosovahn and one of his allies.

action->Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
action->Quick Draw.description: Krosovahn Mendesil Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Krosovahn Mendesil deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures

action->Deflecting Gale.name: Deflecting Gale
action->Deflecting Gale.description:
Trigger Zibini is the target of a physical ranged attack

Requirements Zibini is aware of the attack

Effect A swift gale whips up between Zibini and the source of the ranged attack, giving Zibini a +2 status bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, the wind deflected it. The wind can't deflect unusually large or heavy ranged projectiles (such as boulders or ballista bolts).

action->Deflecting Gale.name: Deflecting Gale
action->Deflecting Gale.description:
Trigger Zibini is the target of a physical ranged attack

Requirements Zibini is aware of the attack

Effect A swift gale whips up between Zibini and the source of the ranged attack, giving Zibini a +2 status bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, the wind deflected it. The wind can't deflect unusually large or heavy ranged projectiles (such as boulders or ballista bolts).

action->Flurry of Kicks.name: Flurry of Kicks
action->Flurry of Kicks.description:
Frequency once per turn

Effect Zibini makes two melee Strikes. He applies his multiple attack penalty to these Strikes normally.

action->Handspring Kick.name: Handspring Kick
action->Handspring Kick.description:
Requirements Zibini has both hands free

Effect Zibini Steps, then makes a melee Strike at a –1 penalty.

Lively Commodore Sticky Fingers.name: Lively Commodore Sticky Fingers
Lively Commodore Sticky Fingers.publicNotes:
The mischievous dragon sprites called draxies have dueled their pixie cousins for the title of ultimate prankster for centuries. They exercise patience and planning to create the perfect pranks, spending months, or even years, on their efforts. One exception to their flighty nature is the elucrea, a lifelong bond between a draxie and a creature they're particularly fond of, typically one with a good sense of humor. According to draxie legend, a little piece of a draxie's spirit remembers being united as the ancient fey dragonet Elucredassa, and that causes draxies to yearn for such connections with others.

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary, all sprites share a connection to magic and a diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The draxie breathes pixie dust in a @Template[cone|distance:15], with a random effect determined each time they use their Breath Weapon. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the effect. Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:17] save or be affected.

The draxie can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

  1. The target takes the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} spell.
  2. The target loses its last 5 minutes of memory.
  3. The target takes the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep} spell.
  4. For 1 minute, the target is in a state of euphoria that makes it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

weapon->Chitin Dagger.name: Chitin Dagger
weapon->Chitin Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

weapon->Rotcarver Scythe.name: Rotcarver Scythe
weapon->Rotcarver Scythe.description: Derived from a farming tool used to mow down long grains and cereals, this weapon has a long wooden shaft with protruding handles, capped with a curved blade set at a right angle.

action->Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
action->Swarming Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[1d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save).

action->Fire Crossbows!.name: Fire Crossbows!
action->Fire Crossbows!.description: The mercenary squad members draw or reload their crossbows, then launch a ranged attack in the form of a volley. This volley is a @Template[burst|distance:10] within 80 feet that deals @Damage[2d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:15|basic] save). When the mercenary squad is reduced to 8 or fewer squares, this area decreases to a @Template[burst|distance:5].

action->Get 'em!.name: Get 'em!
action->Get 'em!.description:
1 to 3

Frequency once per round

Effect The mercenary squad engages in a coordinated melee attack against each adjacent enemy, with a @Check[reflex|dc:15|basic] save. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d6+2)[bludgeoning]] damage

2 @Damage[(1d6+5)[bludgeoning]] damage

3 @Damage[(1d6+8)[bludgeoning]] damage

action->Troop Movement.name: Troop Movement
action->Troop Movement.description:
Whenever the city guards Stride, they first Form Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20- foot area (minus any missing squares), then move up to their Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the guards enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to all the guards.

The mercenary squad ignores difficult terrain (but not greater difficult terrain) caused by crowds or from movement through narrow spaces such as alleyways.

Metal Rascal.name: Metal Rascal
Metal Rascal.publicNotes: The capricious and destructive metal scamps are self-appointed forces of entropy, taking great pleasure in indiscriminately wrecking everything around them, sometimes even to their own detriment. Metal scamps have a severe appearance, with pointed facial features and angular limbs, and their skin can be the color of any metal, often heavily oxidized as if by years of exposure to the elements.

action->Breathe Shrapnel.name: Breathe Shrapnel
action->Breathe Shrapnel.description:
The metal scamp breathes a @Template[cone|distance:15] of jagged metal flakes that deals @Damage[(2d4)[slashing],(1d4)[bleed]] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save).

The metal scamp can't Breathe Shrapnel again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breathe Shrapnel]]{1d4 rounds}.

Mutant Cryptid Pine Pangolin.name: Mutant Cryptid Pine Pangolin
Mutant Cryptid Pine Pangolin.publicNotes: These creatures sleep while hanging upside down by their partially curled tails and rely on their thick wooden scales to protect them from danger. One such danger the scales negate is the falling damage from deliberately rolling up and dropping onto the head of an unsuspecting opponent, which is one of their favorite combat strategies. Beneath their scales, pine pangolin bodies secrete a thick, sticky tar that serves as a secondary line of defense.

action->Explosive End.name: Explosive End
action->Explosive End.description: The mutant pangolin's death reveals one last surprise as it explodes into splinters. When it dies, it explodes, dealing @Damage[4d6[piercing]] damage to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10], with a basic @Check[reflex|dc:26] save.

action->Roll Up.name: Roll Up
action->Roll Up.description: The mutant pine pangolin falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, closes up its scales, and rolls into a ball. While Rolled Up, the pangolin gains resistance 10 to physical damage and total immunity to falling damage from heights of 50 feet or less. The only action the pine pangolin can take is to Stand, and the effects of Roll Up end once the pangolin Stands.

action->Secrete Tar.name: Secrete Tar
action->Secrete Tar.description: The mutant pine pangolin secretes a brown, sticky tar within a @Template[emanation|distance:5], making those squares difficult terrain for 1 minute. Each creature that enters or starts its turn in a tarred square must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it Escapes. On a critical failure, the creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}; prone creatures take a –2 circumstance penalty to their checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} the tar. The pine pangolin is immune to the effects of its own tar.

action->Shifting Iridescence.name: Shifting Iridescence
action->Shifting Iridescence.description: Whenever the mutant pine pangolin takes energy damage to which it isn't resistant or immune, after taking the damage normally, it gains resistance 5 to that damage type. If it had a resistance to a different damage type from shifting iridescence, it replaces the old resistance with the new resistance.

action->Unusual Bane.name: Unusual Bane
action->Unusual Bane.description: This mutant pine pangolin is traumatized by the former Conference Z staff who teamed up to hold it down while experimenting on it. The first time each round the mutant pine pangolin comes within 15 feet of any character who took the Aid action, or is attacked while being flanked by two characters, it takes @Damage[8[mental]] damage and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save. On a failure, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure).

Omertius, The Engorged.name: Omertius, The Engorged
Omertius, The Engorged.publicNotes: For most demons, possessing a creature requires a ritual, magic item, or condition, but for invidiaks, who lack a body, possession is akin to donning a suit of clothing. Known also as shadow demons, invidiaks are formed from envious mortal souls.

action->Blood Possession.name: Blood Possession
action->Blood Possession.description:
Omertius sends himself into his target's blood, controlling them as if af ected by the spell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession}. The target attempts a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] check. Omertius can Dismiss the spell at any time.

Critical Success The target is unafected.

Success Omertius possesses the target but can't control it.

Failure Omertius possesses the target and takes partial control. He no longer has a separate turn; instead, he might control the target. At the start of each of the target's turns, it attempts another Will save. If it fails, it's controlled by Omertius on that turn; if it succeeds, it chooses its own actions; and if it critically succeeds, it forces him out and the spell ends.

Critical Failure Omertius possesses the target fully, and the target can only watch as he manipulates it like a puppet. The target is controlled by Omertius.

Omertius, The Gorger.name: Omertius, The Gorger
Omertius, The Gorger.publicNotes: For most demons, possessing a creature requires a ritual, magic item, or condition, but for invidiaks, who lack a body, possession is akin to donning a suit of clothing. Known also as shadow demons, invidiaks are formed from envious mortal souls.

action->Blood Possession.name: Blood Possession
action->Blood Possession.description:
Omertius sends himself into his target's blood, controlling them as if af ected by the spell @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession}. The target attempts a @Check[fortitude|dc:28] check. Omertius can Dismiss the spell at any time.

Critical Success The target is unafected.

Success Omertius possesses the target but can't control it.

Failure Omertius possesses the target and takes partial control. He no longer has a separate turn; instead, he might control the target. At the start of each of the target's turns, it attempts another Will save. If it fails, it's controlled by Omertius on that turn; if it succeeds, it chooses its own actions; and if it critically succeeds, it forces him out and the spell ends.

Critical Failure Omertius possesses the target fully, and the target can only watch as he manipulates it like a puppet. The target is controlled by Omertius.

Orcish Demonologist.name: Orcish Demonologist
Orcish Demonologist.publicNotes:
Demonologists can pull a creature from the Abyss and bend it to their will... for a time.

Those initiated into the hidden truths and forbidden secrets of the world are forever transformed-or so they claim. To the cynical, a mystic is nothing more than a charlatan or zealot. Others profess to sense an aura around such luminaries and treat them with reverence, lest they offend some harbinger of unspeakable doom.

equipment->Spell Component Pouch.name: Spell Component Pouch
equipment->Spell Component Pouch.description: This pouch contains material components for those spells that require them. Though the components are used up over time, you can refill spent components during your daily preparations.

equipment->Spellbook.name: Spellbook
equipment->Spellbook.description: A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

action->Breach the Abyss.name: Breach the Abyss
action->Breach the Abyss.description:
Requirements The demonologist's last action was to cast a non-cantrip spell

Effect The demonologist siphons energy drawn from the Abyss into their weapon. Until the end of the turn, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 damage.

Roll 1d20 to determine the type:

  • 1-7 acid
  • 8-9 cold
  • 10-11 electricity
  • 12-18 fire
  • 19-20 void

action->Demon Summoning.name: Demon Summoning
action->Demon Summoning.description:
The demonologist can cast a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.29ytKctjg7qSW2ff]{Summon Fiend} arcane spell to summon a demon. To do so, they must sacrifice two 4th-rank prepared spells and voluntarily take @Damage[4d12[mental]] damage that can't be reduced or prevented.

If the demonologist is unable to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3f5DMFu8fPiqHpRg]{Sustain} the Spell, including if they're knocked out or killed, the spell continues, but the GM rolls a @Check[flat|dc:10] each round, ending the spell on a failure.

consumable->Bloodseeker Beak (Affixed to.name: Bloodseeker Beak (Affixed to Rapier)
consumable->Bloodseeker Beak (Affixed to.description:
Activate F (concentrate)

Trigger You hit an off-guard creature with the affixed weapon

This long, hollow proboscis is harvested from the notorious bloodseeker beast and drips a trickle of blood.

When you activate the beak, you deal an extra 1d4 precision damage on your damage roll. If you deal sneak attack damage to the creature, you also deal @Damage[1d4[bleed]].

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.5XdkHIUgc6psBxQq]{Effect: Bloodseeker Beak}

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The creature's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
action->Surprise Attack.description: In the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the orcish throat slitter.

Pampla.name: Pampla
Pampla.publicNotes:
Crocodiles can be found basking on riverbanks, lurking in swamps, or floating in lakes. They are usually are indistinguishable from logs when viewed from afar-at least until they attack. Alligators have similar statistics, but because they often live in more temperate climates, they endure cold temperatures better. Unlike alligators, crocodiles can tolerate salt water. Both are formidable predators that are likely to devour careless adventurers who fail to watch where they step.

Powerful and primeval in appearance, crocodiles are dangerous natural predators that dwell in marshes, riverbeds, swamps, and other wetlands.

action->Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
action->Deep Breath.description: The crocodile can hold its breath for about 2 hours.

action->Death Roll.name: Death Roll
action->Death Roll.description:
Requirements The crocodile must have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Effect The crocodile tucks its legs and rolls rapidly, twisting its victim. It makes a jaws Strike with a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll against the grabbed creature. If it hits, it also knocks the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If it fails, it releases the creature.

action->Fiery Maw.name: Fiery Maw
action->Fiery Maw.description: The crocodile lets out a puff of fire in a @Template[cone|distance:15] dealing @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic] save). It can't use Fiery Maw again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Fiery Maw]]{1d4 rounds}.

Paper Locust Swarm.name: Paper Locust Swarm
Paper Locust Swarm.descriptionHazard: A book unfurls and its case forms into a leathery locust, its pages folding into an overwhelming swarm.
Paper Locust Swarm.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20] to tear up the leather locust, or @Check[arcana|dc:18] (trained) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 22) to render the magic inert.
Paper Locust Swarm.reset: The paper locust swarm resets after 1 minute if there are no creatures to target.
Paper Locust Swarm.routine:
(1 action) The swarm moves up to 30 feet to share the nearest creature's space, slicing into them with their paper wings and spurs. The targeted creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:21] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[(2d8+5)[slashing]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[2d8[slashing]] damage and @Damage[1d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.

Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}.

action->Fold Swarm.name: Fold Swarm
action->Fold Swarm.description:
Trigger A creature touches the bookshelf

Effect The enchanted book transforms into a swarm of origami locusts and one leather locust. The trap then rolls initiative.

Paper Locust Tornado.name: Paper Locust Tornado
Paper Locust Tornado.descriptionHazard: A book unfurls and its case forms into a leathery locust, its pages folding into an overwhelming swarm.
Paper Locust Tornado.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:23] to tear up the leather locust, or @Check[arcana|dc:21] (trained) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3nd rank; counteract DC 25) to render the magic inert.
Paper Locust Tornado.reset: The paper locust tornado resets after 1 minute if there are no creatures to target.
Paper Locust Tornado.routine:
(2 actions) The tornado uses each action to move up to 30 feet and share a creature's space, slicing into them with their paper wings and spurs. The targeted creatures must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:24] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[(2d8+9)[slashing]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[2d8[slashing]] damage and @Damage[1d10[persistent,bleed]] damage.

Critical Failure As failure, and the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}.

action->Fold Swarm.name: Fold Swarm
action->Fold Swarm.description:
Trigger A creature touches the bookshelf

Effect The enchanted book transforms into a tornado of origami locusts and one leather locust. The trap then rolls initiative.

Pit of Lives Lost (1-2).name: Pit of Lives Lost (1-2)
Pit of Lives Lost (1-2).descriptionHazard: The spout trickling blood, sludge, and offal begins to draw upon your life energy, increasing the flow and spreading an even fouler smell within the chamber.
Pit of Lives Lost (1-2).disable: @Check[occultism|dc:17] or @Check[religion|dc:17] (trained) to counteract the fell energies drawing in life force to power this strange charnel flow or @Check[thievery|dc:20] (trained) to disable the spout, stopping the flow at its source.

action->Charnel Flow.name: Charnel Flow
action->Charnel Flow.description:
Trigger: A creature moves adjacent to the pit

Effect The remnants of a soul cage ritual draw upon the life energy of all living creatures in area A4 as well as the 10-foot hallway leading to the room. Each living creature in those areas must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:18|basic] save as the flow of vile liquid saps their very essence. The pull is more intense on more powerful creatures, dealing @Damage[1d6[void]] damage per level the creature has.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage. Additionally, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and cannot reduce the condition's value for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage. Additionally, they are sickened 1 and cannot reduce the condition's value until they leave the Nether Cathedral.

Pit of Lives Lost (3-4).name: Pit of Lives Lost (3-4)
Pit of Lives Lost (3-4).descriptionHazard: The spout trickling blood, sludge, and offal begins to draw upon your life energy, increasing the flow and spreading an even fouler smell within the chamber.
Pit of Lives Lost (3-4).disable: @Check[occultism|dc:20] or @Check[religion|dc:20] (trained) to counteract the fell energies drawing in life force to power this strange charnel flow or @Check[thievery|dc:23] (trained) to disable the spout, stopping the flow at its source.

action->Charnel Flow.name: Charnel Flow
action->Charnel Flow.description:
Trigger A creature moves adjacent to the pit

Effect The remnants of a soul cage ritual draw upon the life energy of all living creatures in areaA4 as well as the 10-foot hallway leading to the room. Each living creature in those areas must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:21|basic] save as the flow of vile liquid saps their very essence. The pull is more intense on more powerful creatures, dealing @Damage[1d6[void]] damage per level the creature has.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage. Additionally, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} and cannot reduce the condition's value for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage. Additionally, they are sickened 1 and cannot reduce the condition's value until they leave the Nether Cathedral.

Possessed Daeodons.name: Possessed Daeodons
Possessed Daeodons.descriptionHazard: Three daeodon corpses, animated and enraged by Sezelrian's divine intervention, trample anything within the ritual circle.
Possessed Daeodons.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:21] or @Check[religion|dc:21] to disrupt the magic animating the spirits, @Check[athletics|dc:25] to hold down one of the daeodons, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd-rank, counteract DC 25). 3 successes are required.
Possessed Daeodons.reset: The hazard resets within 24 hours if the cultists of Sezelrian still remain in the area.
Possessed Daeodons.routine: (three actions) The animated daeodons trample all creatures within the circle, dealing @Damage[(2d8+9)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic] save).
Possessed Daeodons.stealth: or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} to notice the heavy divine magic in the area

action->Fires of Sabotage.name: Fires of Sabotage
action->Fires of Sabotage.description:
Trigger A creature enters the area of the ritual circle

Effect The outline of the circle alights with fire dealing @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage to all creatures within it (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save). The trap then rolls initiative.

Possessed Daeodons (7-8).name: Possessed Daeodons (7-8)

Possessed Daeodons (7-8).reset: The hazard resets within 24 hours if the cultists of Sezelrian still remain in the area.

Possessed Daeodons (7-8).stealth: or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} to notice the heavy divine magic in the area

action->Fires of Sabotage.name: Fires of Sabotage
action->Fires of Sabotage.description:
Trigger A creature enters the area of the ritual circle

Effect The outline of the circle alights with fire dealing @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage to all creatures within it (@Check[reflex|dc:26|basic] save). The trap then rolls initiative.

Raised Draugr.name: Raised Draugr
Raised Draugr.publicNotes:
Risen corpses of sailors who died at sea, draugr reek of the rot and decay of the briny deep. Their eyes glow with ghastly green light, and rotting seaweed, barnacles, and dead sea creatures cling to their bodies. Draugr can't speak, but expresses their malicious emotions with gurgles, as though they were eternally drowning with lungs full of water. They desire little more than to attack living creatures, especially those who sail the sea. Even when they go upon land, draugrs often drag the corpses of those they strike down back to the water, populating the depths with even more dead.

Draugr rise in the haunted places of the sea, where restless spirits, swells of void energy, or supernatural storms deliver death. A corpse might rest at the bottom of the sea for some time before awakening as a draugr. Collecting detritus and organisms, a corpse becomes increasingly disgusting before it finally rises. Proximity to intelligent life can expedite this process, and an underwater explorer who happens upon a shipwreck might cause a body to snap to unlife as a draugr suddenly. The creatures don't take intrusions lightly, especially upon their place of death.

Though steeped in evil, draugr are susceptible to reminders of their lives as mariners. In particular, a well-performed sea shanty or call-and-response work song might cause a draugr to become lost in reverie for a moment. The creatures have even been witnessed moaning along, unable to sing the words but providing haunting accompaniment. The lull rarely lasts long, though, as the beauty of the song quickly becomes a reminder of the tragedy that befell the draugr, reaffirming their desire for blood and death.

More powerful draugr with burning red eyes are called draugr captains. They're 3rd-level creatures with elite adjustments that can cast obscuring mist as an innate divine spell three times per day.

weapon->Greataxe.name: Greataxe
weapon->Greataxe.description: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often "bearded," having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Grotesque Gift.name: Grotesque Gift
action->Grotesque Gift.description: A draugr's attacks spatter their targets with rancid flesh and rotting seaweed. A creature damaged by a draugr's Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:15] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Swipe.name: Swipe
action->Swipe.description: The draugr makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within its melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A Swipe counts as two attacks for the draugr's multiple attack penalty.

action->Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
action->Swarming Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).

Resolved Jamimpi.name: Resolved Jamimpi
Resolved Jamimpi.publicNotes:
The opposite of dark nagas in many ways, guardian nagas are benevolent and wise protectors of places of great natural or supernatural significance: ancient oak groves, forgotten holy temples, and vaults of sacred power are just a few examples of locations that these nagas protect. Guardian nagas believe that the beautiful elements of the cosmos are worthy of protection and that devotion to such a grand effort is its own reward. A guardian naga may join a group with similar values, such as a sect of priests or monks, to aid it in its holy endeavors and to exchange knowledge of the heavens.

Guardian nagas usually encourage their young, upon reaching adulthood, to depart the nest and seek out their own natural wonders or ancient ruins to protect. Sometimes generations of guardian nagas might guard the same place, passing the honor of such care from parent to child. In such cases, the parent nagas aim to have at least one of their children elect to stay behind and become the guardian of their ancestral ward, giving the parents the peace of mind that the site they protect will continue to be guarded by their descendants.

It is difficult for many societies that vilify serpents or see them as symbols of evil to accept the fact that guardian nagas are benevolent and kindly. Fortunately for these people, guardian nagas are also patient and understanding, and see encounters with such societies as opportunities to educate and expand worldviews.

Nagas are serpentine beings with magical powers and keen, nearly inscrutable intellects. Physically, they resemble massive snakes with eerie visages that resemble those of humans. Nagas use their innate magic and poisonous fangs to keep all but the most stalwart foes at bay. Beyond the natural weapons they use to ward away foes, little is understood of the naga's unsettling physiology.

Nagas are intelligent creatures with powerful needs to pursue, be they the accumulation of knowledge, the collection of rare art, or the rule of an entire nation. On Golarion, the nation of Nagajor is one such society-an entire empire ruled by nagas and populated by reptilian humanoids who serve their naga rulers with a patriotic pride that borders on worship.

Still, most adventurers interact with nagas on a much smaller scale, encountering them as dangerous guardians in remote locations or not-so-abandoned ruins. In many cases, these nagas have heard of distant Nagajor, but they are usually unwilling to abandon their own pursuits to seek out a land where they might be worshipped as gods.

Riotous Mushrooms.name: Riotous Mushrooms
Riotous Mushrooms.descriptionHazard: Giant mushrooms sprout from the ground, their caps reaching up to 15 feet high. Each giant mushroom flls up one 5-foot square and can appear anywhere within 20 feet of the center of the ring except adjacent to another giant mushroom. The ring can be disabled but not damaged before it activates.
Riotous Mushrooms.disable: @Check[nature|dc:19] (trained) or @Check[occultism|dc:19] (trained) to repair the runes, @Check[survival|dc:23] (trained) to disturb the soil within the ring to weaken the mushrooms; one successful check to disable this hazard reduces the mushrooms' hardness to 0, and two total successes are required to disable the hazard.
Riotous Mushrooms.reset: The giant mushrooms start to wilt and disappear 1 minute after all conscious living creatures have left the area. After 1 hour, the magic recharges, and the hazard is ready to trigger again.
Riotous Mushrooms.routine: (two actions) A mushroom adjacent to one or more creatures uses Poison Spores. If there are no adjacent creatures, the mushroom vanishes in the ground and reappears in another square, making a Sprout attack. If no conscious creatures are within 20 feet of the center of the ring, the mushroom does nothing. A mushroom will not sprout underneath an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} creature. Each mushroom only acts once.

action->Sprouting Mushrooms.name: Sprouting Mushrooms
action->Sprouting Mushrooms.description:
Trigger A creature touches a standing stone or enters the ring

Effect Two giant mushrooms sprout from the ground, each making a Sprout attack. The hazard then rolls initiative.

action->Poison Spores.name: Poison Spores
action->Poison Spores.description: Adjacent creatures take @Damage[(1d6+6)[poison]|traits:nonlethal]{1d6+6 nonlethal poison} damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic] save).

action->Sprout.name: Sprout
action->Sprout.description:
A giant mushroom appears in a creature's square, dealing @Damage[(1d10+6)[bludgeoning]|traits:nonlethal]{1d10+6 nonlethal bludgeoning} damage and pushing the creature to an adjacent square. The creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage and can choose the square to be moved to.

Success The creature takes half damage and can choose the square to be moved to.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is randomly pushed to an adjacent square.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and is randomly pushed to an adjacent square.

action->Combat Pickpocket.name: Combat Pickpocket
action->Combat Pickpocket.description:
Requirements The robber novice is in the same square or adjacent to the target

Effect The robber novice can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} an object they can see on the target using their Thievery modifier against the target's Perception DC.

Rope Net Trap.name: Rope Net Trap
Rope Net Trap.descriptionHazard: This trap is a net weaved from rope laid out beneath the jungle underbrush with mechanisms attached to some nearby trees; when triggered, it cases the target in the net and suspends them indefinitely.
Rope Net Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:14] to cut the triggering length of rope

action->Ensnare.name: Ensnare
action->Ensnare.description:
Trigger A creature steps on top of where the trap is located

Effect The triggering creature is caught in the rope net. The target must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} in the net and suspended in the air until they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} from the net.

Salted Ghost Pirate Captain.name: Salted Ghost Pirate Captain
Salted Ghost Pirate Captain.publicNotes:
Undead prowling the ocean on derelict ships have long been threats sailors keep an eye out for. Other than corporeal undead, some undead pirates take on an incorporeal form, especially if their bodies have been lost to the fishes. Captains of crews in particular are likely to return from the dead, perhaps on account of their strong personalities.

Tethered to the world after death by powerful emotions that haven't been resolved, ghosts haunt the living as sad echoes of their former selves.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description: When the ghost pirate captain is destroyed, they re-form after [[/br 2d4 #Rejuvenation]]{2d4 days} within the ship or location they're bound to, fully healed. They can be permanently destroyed if their desires are fulfilled, which could involve being defeated in a great battle or ensuring their treasure has been hidden.

action->Combat Current.name: Combat Current
action->Combat Current.description: The ghost makes a Strike with its cutlass or hand crossbow, then Flies up to half their Speed and makes a Strike with the other attack. If they moved through an enemy when they Flew, that enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the second Strike.

action->Savvy Joinin' Me Crew?.name: Savvy Joinin' Me Crew?
action->Savvy Joinin' Me Crew?.description:
Trigger The ghost reduces a living creature to 0 Hit Points with a melee Strike

Effect The creature attempts a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save. If the creature fails its save, it remains conscious but is controlled by the ghost until it loses its dying condition. It continues to attempt recovery checks as normal for the dying condition. The effect ends if the creature loses the dying condition. If the creature dies while under this effect, it joins the ghost's undead crew in [[/gmr 1d4 #days]]{1d4 days}. If the ghost is destroyed before the creature dies, the creature is spared this terrible fate.

Sezelrian Warg.name: Sezelrian Warg
Sezelrian Warg.publicNotes:
Winter wolves are related to wargs, but are larger, smarter, and far more dangerous. They are capable of exhaling plumes of freezing breath and are big enough to easily serve as mounts for orcs and hobgoblins-provided the winter wolf is willing, of course. Like wargs, winter wolves hunt in packs, but unlike their smaller cousins, they have a notable proud streak. When they deign to serve others, they reserve this privilege for larger and more dangerous creatures such as frost giants, renegade yetis, or even white dragons.

The warg is an intelligent and malevolent wolf that dwells among goblins, hobgoblins, orcs, and other violent humanoids.

action->Avenging Bite.name: Avenging Bite
action->Avenging Bite.description:
Trigger A creature within the reach of the Sezelrian warg's jaws attacks one of the warg's allies

Effect The Sezelrian warg makes a jaws Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description: The Sezelrian warg breathes a cloud of smoky fire in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[5d8[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic] save). The Sezelrian warg cannot use Breath Weapon for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
action->Pack Attack.description: The Sezelrian warg's Strikes deal 1d6 extra damage to creatures within the reach of at least two of the warg's allies.

Shadow Draugr.name: Shadow Draugr
Shadow Draugr.publicNotes:

A corpse might rest at the bottom of the sea for some time before awakening as a draugr. Collecting detritus and organisms, a corpse becomes increasingly disgusting before it finally rises. Proximity to intelligent life can expedite this process, and an underwater explorer who happens upon a shipwreck might cause a body to snap to unlife as a draugr suddenly. The creatures don't take intrusions lightly, especially upon their place of death.

The creatures have even been witnessed moaning along, unable to sing the words but providing haunting accompaniment. The lull rarely lasts long, though, as the beauty of the song quickly becomes a reminder of the tragedy that befell the draugr, reaffirming their desire for blood and death.

More powerful draugr with burning red eyes are called draugr captains. They're 3rd-level creatures with elite adjustments that can cast obscuring mist as an innate divine spell three times per day.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->The Void's Revenge.name: The Void's Revenge
action->The Void's Revenge.description: A creature that slays a shadow draugr is subjected to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{Mariner's Curse} spell with a @Check[will|dc:17|traits:spell] save. The curse ends if the draugr is buried in a calm sea or after 1 week passes.

action->Grotesque Gift.name: Grotesque Gift
action->Grotesque Gift.description: The shadow draugr's attacks spatter their targets with rancid flesh and rotting seaweed. A creature damaged by a draugr's Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:15] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).

action->Swipe.name: Swipe
action->Swipe.description: The shadow draugr makes a melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within its melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A Swipe counts as two attacks for the draugr's multiple attack penalty.

Shadow of Sezruth.name: Shadow of Sezruth
Shadow of Sezruth.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Hatred of Beauty.name: Hatred of Beauty
action->Hatred of Beauty.description:
While aghashes hate all mortals, they particularly despise beautiful objects and beautiful or charismatic mortals. When not in physical peril, an aghash is compelled to destroy art and other works of beauty. An aghash can't enter an area of pristine beauty without first marring it in some way.

Given a choice, an aghash attacks a foe with the highest Charisma score first. If barred from doing so by force or some magical effect, they take @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage at the end of their turn.

action->Cursed Gaze.name: Cursed Gaze
action->Cursed Gaze.description:
The aghash fixes their gaze on one creature they can see within 20 feet. The creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage and becomes either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (the aghash's choice).

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

action->Sandstorm.name: Sandstorm
action->Sandstorm.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The aghash creates a temporary sandstorm in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] that lasts for 1 minute.

Creatures within the emanation take a -4 circumstance penalty to Perception checks and must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:15] save. On a failure, they're forced to hold their breath or else they start suffocating. A creature within the sandstorm at the end of its turn takes @Damage[1d4[slashing]] damage.

Divs are immune to all effects of an aghash's sandstorm.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.f8rncEs06bqcn3LZ]{Effect: Sandstorm}

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The creature's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The creature's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Faceglomph.name: Faceglomph
action->Faceglomph.description:
Trigger The sharktopus eidolon makes a successful tentacle strike

Effect the sharktopus makes an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}. If it is successful, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until it escapes.

Sharp Pukwudgie.name: Sharp Pukwudgie
Sharp Pukwudgie.publicNotes:
Pukwudgies go by many names in many regions, but those who know of them agree that defying their mischievous nature provokes their wrath.

In ancient times, pukwudgies traveled to the Material Plane from the First World, perhaps in the wake of the gnome emigration. These proud fey are obsessed with displays of respect, and while they first attempted to befriend mortals, each attempt ended in tragedy as the pukwudgies perceived any potential slight as a grave insult. Mortals, fearing these reactions, began to view pukwudgies as nuisances, and pukwudgies in turn began to resent mortals and the gods that favored them. At their best, pukwudgies play cruel jokes on mortals they encounter. At their worst, they've been known to kidnap and even kill those who don't treat them with proper respect.

Pukwudgies make their villages in the oldest forests, concealed under @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Mirage} spells and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.nA0XlPsnMNrQMpio]{Fantastic Facade} rituals. They travel freely between the Material Plane and the First World through tiny portals beneath hills, trees, or stones. No strangers to violence, pukwudgies rarely travel alone and often anoint their quills or weapons with a custom-brewed poison before entering hostile situations.

Standing about 2 feet tall, a pukwudgie sports sharp quills growing from their head that extends down their back. Their skin tone varies by the region in which they live, ranging from pale gray to brown.

action->Defensive Quills.name: Defensive Quills
action->Defensive Quills.description:
A creature that hits a pukwudgie with an unarmed Strike or a non-reach melee Strike takes @Damage[3d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:23|basic] save). On a critical failure, the creature also takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,poison]] from the poisoned quills.

Note: A DC was not provided for this ability by Paizo. The DC present here is a moderate DC for the creature level according to the Gamemastery Guide creature building Tables

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
The pukwudgie takes on the physical form of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-3.Actor.IijUBFE1vhvgowhD]{Giant Porcupine}. Their size changes to Medium, they lose their weapon Strikes, and they gain a quill Strike (+20 for 2d8+8 piercing plus 1d8 persistent poison).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Pukwudgie Poison.name: Pukwudgie Poison
action->Pukwudgie Poison.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:27]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, and stupefied 2 (1 round)

equipment->Religious Symbol of Zura.name: Religious Symbol of Zura
equipment->Religious Symbol of Zura.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol can be worn on the body on a chain or pin, or can be held.

action->Demon-Touched Weapon.name: Demon-Touched Weapon
action->Demon-Touched Weapon.description:
Frequency once per turn

Requirements Shenga's most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip spell

Effect Until the end of her next turn, Shenga deals 1d6 bleed damage with her melee Strikes.

action->Reach Spell.name: Reach Spell
action->Reach Spell.description: If the next action the Shenga Heartrender uses is to Cast a Spell that has a range, increase that spell's range by 30 feet.

Shining Shooting Sphere.name: Shining Shooting Sphere
Shining Shooting Sphere.descriptionHazard: A gilded armillary sphere spins in place, shooting jeweled stars and planets at intruders.
Shining Shooting Sphere.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:21] (expert) to disable the sphere from rotating or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3nd rank; counteract DC 23) to remove the enchantment.
Shining Shooting Sphere.reset: The trap deactivates and resets if 1 minute passes without any creature moving within range of its sensor.
Shining Shooting Sphere.routine: (1 action) A jeweled planet shoots from the sphere, targeting a random creature within 30 feet. The creature takes @Damage[(2d8+7)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).
Shining Shooting Sphere.stealth: (expert) to notice the floor sensor; DC 0 to notice the sphere

action->Orbital Spin.name: Orbital Spin
action->Orbital Spin.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 10 feet of the sphere, stepping on the floor sensor

Effect The sphere rotates and the trap rolls initiative.

Shooting Sphere.name: Shooting Sphere
Shooting Sphere.descriptionHazard: A gilded armillary sphere spins in place, shooting jeweled stars and planets at intruders.
Shooting Sphere.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:18] (expert) to disable the sphere from rotating or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 20) to remove the enchantment.
Shooting Sphere.reset: The trap deactivates and resets if 1 minute passes without any creature moving within range of its sensor.
Shooting Sphere.routine: (1 action) A jeweled planet shoots from the sphere, targeting a random creature within 30 feet. The creature takes @Damage[(1d10+6)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic] save).
Shooting Sphere.stealth: (expert) to notice the floor sensor; DC 0 to notice the sphere

action->Orbital Spin.name: Orbital Spin
action->Orbital Spin.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 10 feet of the sphere, stepping on the floor sensor

Effect The sphere rotates and the trap rolls initiative.

Shrewd Busoborn Akata.name: Shrewd Busoborn Akata
Shrewd Busoborn Akata.publicNotes:
An akata is a hairless, blue-skinned quadruped with fearsome jaws, glowing eyes, a pair of thin tails, and a mane of writhing tentacles. It is a strangely silent beast, as it lacks the lungs and vocal chords necessary to vocalize. It also lacks ears, but it has heightened visual and olfactory senses.

When food is scarce, an akata secretes a resin from its pores that forms into a sturdy cocoon of pale green crystal-the skymetal noqual. An akata can hibernate in this cocoon without needing to eat or drink for centuries, though it retains a rudimentary sense of its surroundings and can break out in only a few minutes' time. These cocoons allow the creatures to travel through the void of space, seeking new worlds where they can infect suitable humanoid hosts with their larval young. Once a victim succumbs to this infection, the offspring fight among themselves until one proves the strongest. The surviving akata then animates the corpse-now a void zombie-which shambles about of its own accord.

action->Hibernation.name: Hibernation
action->Hibernation.description: After 3 or more days without eating, an akata can secrete resin that encases it in a noqual cocoon. The cocoon has Hardness 9, 40 HP, and a Broken Threshold of 18. It has resistance 5 to damage from magical sources. As long as the cocoon remains intact, the akata can't be harmed, and it doesn't need to eat or drink. While inside the cocoon, the akata gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.sebk9XseMCRkDqRg]{Lifesense} 30 feet. The akata remains in a state of hibernation until it is exposed to extreme heat or senses a living creature, at which point it can burst free of its cocoon in [[/gmr 1d4 #minutes]]{1d4 minutes}.

action->No Hearing.name: No Hearing
action->No Hearing.description: An akata has no auditory senses. It is immune to auditory effects, automatically critically fails Perception checks that require it to hear, and takes a -2 status penalty to Perception checks (but not initiative rolls) that involve sound but also rely on other senses.

action->Bark Shield.name: Bark Shield
action->Bark Shield.description:
Trigger The busoborn akata takes damage that isn't fire

Effect The akata hardens its body into a bark-like material at the point of impact and reduces the damage it takes by 5.

action->No Breath.name: No Breath
action->No Breath.description: An akata doesn't breathe and is immune to effects that require breathing (such as an inhaled poison).

action->Salt Water Vulnerability.name: Salt Water Vulnerability
action->Salt Water Vulnerability.description: Salt water acts as an extremely strong acid to an akata. A splash of salt water deals @Damage[1d6[acid]] damage to an akata, and damaging salt water effects deal 1d6 additional damage. Full immersion in salt water deals @Damage[4d6[acid]] damage per round.

action->Grasping Tendrils.name: Grasping Tendrils
action->Grasping Tendrils.description:
The busoborn akata presses one of its tentacle vines to the ground and causes it to spread beneath creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:15] in front of it. Until the end of its next turn, the area is difficult terrain to enemy creatures, and the akata gains a +2 circumstance bonus to attack rolls against targets within that area

Special The akata can only use this ability if it has no more than one creature grappled.

action->Pack Attack.name: Pack Attack
action->Pack Attack.description: The busoborn akata's Strikes deal an additional 1d10 damage to creatures within reach of at least two of its allies.

action->Void Death.name: Void Death
action->Void Death.description:
An akata implants its parasitic larval young into any creature it bites, but only Medium or Small humanoids make suitable hosts; all other creatures are immune to this disease

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:17]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect 1 (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 drained 2 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead and corpse rises as a void zombie in [[/br 2d4 #hours]]{2d4 hours}

Shurrizih.name: Shurrizih
Shurrizih.publicNotes: Regarded as the progenitors of geniekind, janns hold a position of esteem above the genies tied to specific planes. They possess an inborn ability to grant wishes, which the other branches of geniekind lack and greatly envy. Nomadic jann shuyookhs rarely hold court, preferring to gather only when the need arises to perform great deeds. Lesser janns respect and venerate these leaders for their wisdom and total dedication to preserving the honor and reputation of their people. A jann shuyookh reads portents and omens when dealing with duplicitous mortals.

spell->Interplanar Teleport (At Will; To.name: Interplanar Teleport (At Will; To Astral Plane, Elemental Planes, or the Universe only)

action->Commanding Presence.name: Commanding Presence
action->Commanding Presence.description: 20 feet. A creature that enters the aura must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:17] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure), and is then temporarily immune for 1 minute. A genie (with the exception of another jann) takes a –4 circumstance penalty to their save.

action->Elemental Resistance.name: Elemental Resistance
action->Elemental Resistance.description: The jann shuyookh's elemental resistance applies to cold, electricity, and fire damage, as well as all damage from elemental sources (including environmental damage from the elemental planes and damage from anything with the air, earth, fire, metal, water, or wood trait).

action->All Made One.name: All Made One
action->All Made One.description:
The jann shuyookh calls upon all the elements that make up their being and chooses one. They gain an additional arcane spell they can cast at will and empower their Strikes with the element, dealing an extra 1d6 damage of the listed type. These benefits last until the shuyookh uses this ability again.

  • Air: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9AAkVUCwF6WVNNY2]{Lightning Bolt}, 1d6 electricity;
  • Earth: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vh1RpbWfqdNC4L3P]{One with Stone}, 1d6 bludgeoning;
  • Fire: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball}, 1d6 fire;
  • Metal: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.3A3ueS9Q0s3U8KXE]{Noxious Metals}, 1d6 electricity;
  • Water: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.LNOwaJAkCfsgTKgV]{Wall of Water}, 1d6 bludgeoning;
  • Wood: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KsWhliKfUs3IpW3c]{Wall of Thorns}, 1d6 piercing.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
The jann transforms into a Small or Medium elemental or animal. This doesn't affect the gennayn's statistics, but it could change the damage type of their Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Spicebomb.name: Spicebomb
Spicebomb.descriptionHazard: Several spice bombs disguised as rocks litter the ground.
Spicebomb.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:12] to remove the bombs without activating them or @Check[survival|dc:13] (trained) to render them inert.

action->Peppery Explosion.name: Peppery Explosion
action->Peppery Explosion.description:
Trigger A creature steps on a spice bomb

Effect The spice bombs explode into clouds of spicy, choking gas that envelops the area. All creatures within 30 feet must succeed a @Check[fortitude|dc:14] save or take @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage. On a critical failure, the creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Spicebomb (3-4).name: Spicebomb (3-4)
Spicebomb (3-4).descriptionHazard: Several spice bombs disguised as rocks litter the ground.

Effect The spice bombs explode into clouds of spicy, choking gas that envelops the area. All creatures within 30 feet must succeed a @Check[fortitude|dc:16] save or take @Damage[2d10[poison]] damage. On a critical failure, the creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Springloaded Statues.name: Springloaded Statues
Springloaded Statues.descriptionHazard: Four animal statues sit on pillars, one in each corner of the statuary, with decorated tiles between them in a seemingly random arrangement.
Springloaded Statues.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:28] (expert) or @Check[stealth|dc:31] (expert) to disarm the statue while adjacent to it
Springloaded Statues.reset: Each statue resets immediately after being triggered.

action->Iced.name: Iced
action->Iced.description:

action->Slithering Shock.name: Slithering Shock
action->Slithering Shock.description:

action->Yowl.name: Yowl

Sprite (PFS Q18).name: Sprite (PFS Q18)
Sprite (PFS Q18).publicNotes:
Common sprites, sometimes called firefly sprites, are primeval guardians that latch onto a person, place, or object and defend it for their own inscrutable reasons. Their dispositions vary from kind to spiteful, but all sprites have a capricious streak. Being only about 9 inches tall, they are wary of animals that might hunt them, particularly house cats, and prefer flight to a fight. On the other hand, sprites are incredibly curious about all forms of magic and heedlessly gather around ley line nexuses or other places of power.

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary, all sprites share a connection to magic and a diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.

action->Luminous Fire.name: Luminous Fire
action->Luminous Fire.description: A sprite naturally sheds light like a torch. The sprite can extinguish, rekindle, or change the color of this light by using an action with the concentrate trait. While this light is extinguished, the sprite's Strikes don't deal fire damage, and they can't use their luminous spark Strike.

Spry Blodeuwedd.name: Spry Blodeuwedd
Spry Blodeuwedd.publicNotes:
The mysterious blodeuwedds dwell in those parts of the world where the boundaries between the Material Plane and the First World have worn thin, or around portals between the two planes. Their link with such regions of the natural world is so strong that it rivals the bond shared between nymphs and places of great natural beauty, yet none would look upon a blodeuwedd and mistake them for something as elegant as a nymph.

Although blodeuwedds share certain traits with nymphs, their role as guardians of the pathways between this world and the First World prevents them from forming as powerful a magical bond with the natural world. Never truly a part of either reality yet forced to keep watch over both, blodeuwedds tend to grow cynical and sharp-tongued toward any who would seek travel from one realm to the other, regardless of their actual goals.

weapon->Sling.name: Sling
weapon->Sling.description: Little more than a leather cup attached to a pair of straps, a sling can be used to fling smooth stones or sling bullets at a range.

action->Wild Empathy.name: Wild Empathy
action->Wild Empathy.description: The blodeuwedd can use Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on and make very simple @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Requests} of animals.

action->Allergen Aura.name: Allergen Aura
action->Allergen Aura.description: A blodeuwedd exudes a 30-foot aura of pollen and irritating allergens. A non-plant living creature that begins its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}. A creature that succeeds at its save is then temporarily immune to the allergen aura for 24 hours. A blodeuwedd can suppress this aura or activate it again as a free action.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
A blodeuwedd can take on the appearance of a single unique humanoid or the form of a prairie owl.

When in humanoid form, the blodeuwedd loses its claw attack.

In owl form, its statistics change as follows:

  • Size Small;
  • Speed fly 60 feet;
  • Melee a talons [[/r {1d20+15} #Attack]]{+15}, Damage @Damage[(1d3-1)[slashing]].

A blodeuwedd can return to their normal form as a free action.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Living Footsteps.name: Living Footsteps
action->Living Footsteps.description: Every Stride action taken by a blodeuwedd causes small plants, grasses, and wildflowers to sprout from the ground, though they can suppress this effect if they desire. In a region or terrain that wouldn't normally support plant life, these plants thrive for 1 minute before withering away.

action->Nature's Infusion.name: Nature's Infusion
action->Nature's Infusion.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect While surrounded by any field or fertile plain, a blodeuwedd can infuse themself with borrowed life energy from nearby plants and nutrients in the ground. The blodeuwedd gains 15 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 hour.

action->Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
action->Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger Sronwa is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker she can see

Effect Sronwa gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

action->Poison Weapon.name: Poison Weapon
action->Poison Weapon.description:
Requirements Sronwa is wielding a piercing or slashing weapon and has a free hand

Effect Sronwa applies a poison to the weapon.

action->Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
action->Quick Draw.description: Sronwa Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Sronwa deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
action->Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger Sronwa is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker she can see

Effect Sronwa gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

action->Poison Weapon.name: Poison Weapon
action->Poison Weapon.description:
Requirements Sronwa is wielding a piercing or slashing weapon and has a free hand

Effect Sronwa applies a poison to the weapon.

action->Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
action->Quick Draw.description: Sronwa Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Sronwa deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
action->Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the Sronwa.

Steadied Dohv-Dranna.name: Steadied Dohv-Dranna
Steadied Dohv-Dranna.publicNotes:
The grotesque brain collectors originate from worlds far beyond the known solar system, and are part of a conglomeration of hostile aliens known collectively as the Dominion of the Black. Whether driven by their own schemes or directives from sinister overlords, brain collectors arrive in living starships to harvest the brains of intelligent creatures. These aberrations draw no nutrition from brains, instead storing them for analysis and as vessels for occult magical energies.

A brain collector's form evokes that of a tailless scorpion, but the pulsing brain-filled blisters that glisten along its back make them impossible to mistake for merely oversized arachnids. Baleful eyes glare from the joints on their legs, and the unsettling, intrusive whisper-thoughts they telepathically broadcast into the minds of those they seek to feed on can be interpreted as threats or promises alike.

Brain collectors have very little empathy for the denizens of any world they visit, despite the fact that certain cults venerate them, or the Dominion they hail from, as if they were gods. To brain collectors, terrestrial creatures are simply resources for their magical needs and occult powers. They have little interest in worshipping gods or being worshipped themselves, yet they do practice strange forms of religion of their own, in which they consider the primordial forces of deep space as worthy of faith and fear.
Steadied Dohv-Dranna.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Brain Blisters.name: Brain Blisters
action->Brain Blisters.description: A brain collector has seven brain blisters on its back that it uses to house stolen brains. A brain collector without all seven blisters full is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied} with a value equal to the number of empty blisters.

action->Brain Loss.name: Brain Loss
action->Brain Loss.description: If a brain collector takes 30 damage from a critical hit or takes 25 mental damage, it must succeed at a DC 29 save (@Check[fortitude|dc:29] for critical damage or @Check[will|dc:29] for mental damage) or one of its brain blisters is destroyed.

action->Brain Collector Venom.name: Brain Collector Venom
action->Brain Collector Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:29]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage, enfeebled 1, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, and slowed 1 (1 round)

action->Collect Brain.name: Collect Brain
action->Collect Brain.description: The brain collector collects a brain of a creature that has been dead for no more than 1 minute. It can then use an Interact action to secure the brain in one of its empty brain blisters.

action->Explosive End.name: Explosive End
action->Explosive End.description: The mutant brain collector's death reveals one last surprise as it explodes into radioactive ash. When it dies, it explodes, dealing @Damage[5d6[acid]] damage to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10], with a basic @Check[reflex|dc:27] save.

action->Shifting Iridescence.name: Shifting Iridescence
action->Shifting Iridescence.description: Whenever the mutant brain collector takes energy damage to which it isn't resistant or immune, after taking the damage normally, it gains resistance 10 to that damage type. If it had a resistance to a different damage type from shifting iridescence, it replaces the old resistance with the new resistance.

Studied Orcish Demonologist.name: Studied Orcish Demonologist
Studied Orcish Demonologist.publicNotes:
Demonologists can pull a creature from the Abyss and bend it to their will... for a time.

Those initiated into the hidden truths and forbidden secrets of the world are forever transformed-or so they claim. To the cynical, a mystic is nothing more than a charlatan or zealot. Others profess to sense an aura around such luminaries and treat them with reverence, lest they offend some harbinger of unspeakable doom.

equipment->Spell Component Pouch.name: Spell Component Pouch
equipment->Spell Component Pouch.description: This pouch contains material components for those spells that require them. Though the components are used up over time, you can refill spent components during your daily preparations.

equipment->Spellbook.name: Spellbook
equipment->Spellbook.description: A spellbook holds the written knowledge necessary to learn and prepare various spells, a necessity for wizards (who typically get one for free) and a useful luxury for other spellcasters looking to learn additional spells. Each spellbook can hold up to 100 spells. The Price listed is for a blank spellbook.

action->Breach the Abyss.name: Breach the Abyss
action->Breach the Abyss.description:
Requirements The demonologist's last action was to cast a non-cantrip spell

Effect The demonologist siphons energy drawn from the Abyss into their weapon. Until the end of the turn, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 damage.

Roll 1d20 to determine the type:

  • 1-7 acid
  • 8-9 cold
  • 10-11 electricity
  • 12-18 fire
  • 19-20 void

action->Demon Summoning.name: Demon Summoning
action->Demon Summoning.description:
The demonologist can cast a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.29ytKctjg7qSW2ff]{Summon Fiend} arcane spell to summon a demon. To do so, they must sacrifice two 4th-rank prepared spells and voluntarily take @Damage[4d12[mental]] damage that can't be reduced or prevented.

If the demonologist is unable to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3f5DMFu8fPiqHpRg]{Sustain} the Spell, including if they're knocked out or killed, the spell continues, but the GM rolls a @Check[flat|dc:10] each round, ending the spell on a failure.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
The tanuki can transform into a mundane raccoon dog, using the statistics of pest form. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The tanuki loses any unarmed Strikes they gained from a tanuki heritage or ancestry feat in this form. The tanuki can remain in the raccoon dog form indefinitely, and can shift back to the tanuki form by using this action again.

action->Three Headed.description: Any ability that would sever one of the three-headed goat's heads (such as a critical hit with a vorpal weapon) severs one head at random. Losing a head doesn't kill the three-headed goat (as long as it has one head left), but it does prevent it from making Strikes with the lost head or using the head's Breath Weapon.

action->Triple Opportunity.name: Triple Opportunity
action->Triple Opportunity.description: The three-headed goat eidolon gains 2 extra reactions each round that it can use only to make Attacks of Opportunity. It must use a different head for each reaction, and it can't use more than one on the same triggering action. If it loses one of its heads, it also loses one of these extra reactions.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The two-headed goat breathes a @Template[cone|distance:20] that deals 3d6 damage to all creatures in the area (DC 18 basic save of a type indicated below).

The two-headed goat can't use either of its Breath Weapons again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Boer Cone of @Damage[3d6[sonic]] (@Check[will|dc:18|basic])
  • Markhor Cone of @Damage[3d6[poison]] (@Check[fortitude|dc:18|basic])
  • Saanen Cone of @Damage[3d6[fire]] (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic])

action->Elemental Bite.name: Elemental Bite
action->Elemental Bite.description: Each head deals an extra 1d6 damage of a type matching the head's breath weapon.

action->Three-Headed Strike.name: Three-Headed Strike

The first time each round Tisbah Sustains this Spell, she can attempt to Shove the creature again. The target takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until the spell ends.

Telekinetic Projectile: Tisbah increases the damage of this cantrip by [[/r 2d6]]. On a successful Strike, she pushes the target 5 feet away, or 10 feet away on a critical success.
